descriptions.kingler-gmax: The flow of Gigantamax energy has spurred this Pokémon's left pincer to grow to an enormous size. That claw can pulverize anything.
descriptions.voltorb-hisui: An enigmatic Pokémon that happens to bear a resemblance to a Poké Ball. When excited, it discharges the electric current it has stored in its belly, then lets out a great, uproarious laugh.
descriptions.electrode-hisui: The tissue on the surface of its body is curiously similar in composition to an Apricorn. When irritated, this Pokémon lets loose an electric current equal to 20 lightning bolts.
descriptions.exeggutor-alola: This Pokémon's psychic powers aren't as strong as they once were. The head on this Exeggutor's tail scans surrounding areas with weak telepathy.
descriptions.marowak-alola: When it beats opponents with its bone, the cursed flames spread to them. No amount of water will stop those flames from burning.
descriptions.weezing-galar: This Pokémon consumes particles that contaminate the air. Instead of leaving droppings, it expels clean air.
descriptions.kangaskhan-mega: When the mother sees the back of her Mega- Evolved child, it makes her think of the day when her child will inevitably leave her.
descriptions.mrmime-galar: Its talent is tap-dancing. It can also manipulate temperatures to create a floor of ice, which this Pokémon can kick up to use as a barrier.
descriptions.pinsir-mega: It zips around at blistering speeds, looking for an opening to skewer its opponent on its giant pincers.
descriptions.tauros-paldeacombat: This Pokémon has a muscular body and excels at close-quarters combat. It uses its short horns to strike the opponent's weak spots.
descriptions.tauros-paldeablaze: When heated by fire energy, its horns can get hotter than 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. Those gored by them will suffer both wounds and burns.
descriptions.tauros-paldeaaqua: This Pokémon blasts water from holes on the tips of its horns—the high-pressure jets pierce right through Tauros's enemies.
descriptions.gyarados-mega: It zooms out of the water at Mach speeds. Even large ships caught in its path are split cleanly in two!
descriptions.lapras-gmax: Over 5,000 people can ride on its shell at once. And it's a very comfortable ride, without the slightest shaking or swaying.
descriptions.eevee-gmax: Gigantamax energy upped the fluffiness of the fur around Eevee's neck. The fur will envelop a foe, capturing its body and captivating its mind.
descriptions.aerodactyl-mega: Mega Evolution awakened some dormant genes, bringing back the sharp rocks that once covered Aerodactyl's entire body.
descriptions.snorlax-gmax: Gigantamax energy has affected stray seeds and even pebbles that got stuck to Snorlax, making them grow to a huge size.
descriptions.articuno-galar: Its feather-like blades are composed of psychic energy and can shear through thick iron sheets as if they were paper.
descriptions.zapdos-galar: When its feathers rub together, they produce a crackling sound like the zapping of electricity. That's why this Pokémon is called Zapdos.
descriptions.moltres-galar: This Pokémon's sinister, flame-like aura will consume the spirit of any creature it hits. Victims become burned-out shadows of themselves.
descriptions.mewtwo-megax: Psychic power has augmented its muscles. It has a grip strength of one ton and can sprint a hundred meters in two seconds flat!
descriptions.mewtwo-megay: Despite its diminished size, its mental power has grown phenomenally. With a mere thought, it can smash a skyscraper to smithereens.
descriptions.typhlosion-hisui: Said to purify lost, forsaken souls with its flames and guide them to the afterlife. I believe its form has been influenced by the energy of the sacred mountain towering at Hisui's center.
descriptions.ampharos-mega: Massive amounts of energy intensely stimulated Ampharos's cells, apparently awakening its long-sleeping dragon's blood.
descriptions.wooper-paldea: After losing a territorial struggle, Wooper began living on land. The Pokémon changed over time, developing a poisonous film to protect its body.
descriptions.slowking-galar: A combination of toxins and the shock of evolving has increased Shellder's intelligence to the point that Shellder now controls Slowking.
descriptions.unown-b: This Pokémon is shaped like ancient writing. It is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various Unown. Research into this topic is ongoing but nothing is known.

descriptions.qwilfish-hisui: It lives just offshore in cold parts of the world. Its poisonous spikes are thicker and shorter than those of other regions' Qwilfish.
descriptions.scizor-mega: It's better at beating things than grasping them. When it battles for a long time, the weight of its pincers becomes too much to bear.
descriptions.heracross-mega: A tremendous influx of energy builds it up, but when Mega Evolution ends, Heracross is bothered by terrible soreness in its muscles.
descriptions.sneasel-hisui: Its sturdy, curved claws are ideal for traversing precipitous cliffs. From the tips of these claws drips a venom that infiltrates the nerves of any prey caught in Sneasel's grasp.
descriptions.corsola-galar: Watch your step when wandering areas oceans once covered. What looks like a stone could be this Pokémon, and it will curse you if you kick it.
descriptions.houndoom-mega: Houndoom's entire body generates heat when it Mega Evolves. Its fearsome fiery breath turns its opponents to ash.
descriptions.tyranitar-mega: The effects of Mega Evolution make it more ferocious than ever. It's unclear whether it can even hear its Trainer's orders.
descriptions.zigzagoon-galar: Its restlessness has it constantly running around. If it sees another Pokémon, it will purposely run into them in order to start a fight.
descriptions.linoone-galar: It uses its long tongue to taunt opponents. Once the opposition is enraged, this Pokémon hurls itself at the opponent, tackling them forcefully.
descriptions.sableye-mega: It blocks any and all attacks with its giant-sized gemstone. However, the stone's a heavy burden, and it limits Mega Sableye's movements.
descriptions.mawile-mega: Its two sets of jaws thrash about violently as if they each had a will of their own. One gnash from them can turn a boulder to dust.
descriptions.manectric-mega: Too much electricity has built up in its body, irritating Manectric. Its explosive speed is equal to that of a lightning bolt.
descriptions.sharpedo-mega: The moment it charges into its opponent, sharp spikes pop out of Sharpedo's head, leaving its opponent with deep wounds.
descriptions.castform-sunny: Castform changes to this form when it basks in bright sunlight. When you touch its glowing skin, it feels all dried out!
descriptions.castform-rainy: This is Castform's form when pelted by rain. In an experiment where it was placed in a shower, this Pokémon didn't change to this form.
descriptions.castform-snowy: This is Castform's form when caught in a hailstorm. Its whole body is chilled, and its skin is partially frozen!
descriptions.banette-mega: Mega Evolution increases its vindictiveness, and the cursing power that was held back by its zipper comes spilling out.
descriptions.absol-mega: It converts the energy from Mega Evolution into an intimidating aura. Fainthearted people expire from shock at the sight of it.
descriptions.glalie-mega: The power of Mega Evolution was so strong that it smashed Glalie's jaw. Its inability to eat very well leaves Glalie irritated.
descriptions.salamence-mega: It puts its forelegs inside its shell to streamline itself for flight. Salamence flies at high speeds over all kinds of topographical features.
descriptions.metagross-mega: When it knows it can't win, it digs the claws on its legs into its opponent and starts the countdown to a big explosion.
descriptions.kyogre-primal: Through Primal Reversion and with nature's full power, it will take back its true form. It can summon storms that cause the sea levels to rise.
descriptions.groudon-primal: Through Primal Reversion and with nature's full power, it will take back its true form. It can cause magma to erupt and expand the landmass of the world.
descriptions.rayquaza-mega: It flies forever through the ozone layer, consuming meteoroids for sustenance. The many meteoroids in its body provide the energy it needs to Mega Evolve.
descriptions.burmy-sandy: It creates a cloak by weaving together sand, mud, and silk it has spat out. This earthen cloak is ruined by wind and rain, so the Pokémon hides away in caves and other such places.
descriptions.burmy-trash: When confronted by a lack of other materials, Burmy will create its cloak using dust and refuse. The cloak seems to be more comfortable than one would think.
descriptions.wormadam-sandy: Its earthen skin is reasonably hard—it has no problem repelling a Starly's pecking, at least.
descriptions.wormadam-trash: Its body, composed of refuse, blends in to the scenery so much as to be inconspicuous. This seems to be the perfect way for the Pokémon to evade the detection of predators.
descriptions.cherrim-sunshine: After absorbing plenty of sunlight, Cherrim takes this form. It's full of energy while it's like this, and its liveliness will go on until sundown.
descriptions.shellos-east: Scientists interested in its great regenerative capabilities are currently analyzing the materials from which its cells are made.
descriptions.gastrodon-east: A relative of Shellder and Cloyster, this ocean dweller sometimes comes onto land in search of food.
descriptions.lopunny-mega: Mega Evolution awakens its combative instincts. It has shed any fur that got in the way of its attacks.
descriptions.garchomp-mega: Its disposition is more vicious than before its Mega Evolution. Garchomp carves its opponents up with the scythes on both arms.
descriptions.lucario-mega: Bathed in explosive energy, its combative instincts have awakened. For its enemies, it has no mercy whatsoever.
descriptions.rotom-heat: This Rotom has possessed a convection microwave oven that uses a special motor. It also has a flair for manipulating flames.
descriptions.rotom-wash: This form of Rotom enjoys coming up with water- based pranks. Be careful with it if you don't want your room flooded.
descriptions.rotom-frost: Rotom assumes this form when it takes over a refrigerator powered by a special motor. It battles by spewing cold air.
descriptions.rotom-fan: In this form, Rotom applies its new power over wind to its love of pranks. It will happily blow away any important documents it can find.
descriptions.rotom-mow: This is Rotom after it's seized control of a lawn mower that has a special motor. As it mows down grass, it scatters the clippings everywhere.
descriptions.dialga-origin: Radiant light caused Dialga to take on a form bearing a striking resemblance to the creator Pokémon. Dialga now wields such colossal strength that one must conclude this is its true form.
descriptions.palkia-origin: It soars across the sky in a form that greatly resembles the creator of all things. Perhaps this imitation of appearance is Palkia's strategy for gaining Arceus's powers.
descriptions.giratina-origin: Giratina loses its legs upon changing into this form. I believe this Pokémon must hail from a world where the heavens and the earth are as one, though I have no way of proving it.
descriptions.shaymin-sky: Upon taking in the scent of a particular rare flower, Shaymin is enveloped in light, and its tiny body transforms. I took a whiff of the flower myself, but alas, my body remained unchanged.
descriptions.arceus-fighting: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-flying: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-poison: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-ground: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-rock: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-bug: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-ghost: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-steel: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-fire: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-water: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-grass: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-electric: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-psychic: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-ice: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-dragon: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-dark: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-fairy: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.samurott-hisui: Hard of heart and deft of blade, this rare form of Samurott is a product of the Pokémon's evolution in the region of Hisui. Its turbulent blows crash into foes like ceaseless pounding waves.
descriptions.lilligant-hisui: I suspect that its well-developed legs are the result of a life spent on mountains covered in deep snow. The scent it exudes from its flower crown heartens those in proximity.
descriptions.basculin-bluestriped: These Pokémon form schools with others of the same color. The greatest foe of a school of blue Basculin is a school of red Basculin.
descriptions.basculin-white: They live in frigid seas, forming schools and sharing food among themselves. When the time comes, they return to the river they were born in.
descriptions.darumaka-galar: It lived in snowy areas for so long that its fire sac cooled off and atrophied. It now has an organ that generates cold instead.
descriptions.darmanitan-zen: Through meditation, it calms its raging spirit and hones its psychic powers.
descriptions.darmanitan-galar: On days when blizzards blow through, it comes down to where people live. It stashes food in the snowball on its head, taking it home for later.
descriptions.darmanitan-galarzen: Anger has reignited its atrophied flame sac. This Pokémon spews fire everywhere as it rampages indiscriminately.
descriptions.yamask-galar: A clay slab with cursed engravings took possession of a Yamask. The slab is said to be absorbing the Yamask's dark power.
descriptions.garbodor-gmax: Due to Gigantamax energy, this Pokémon's toxic gas has become much thicker, congealing into masses shaped like discarded toys.
descriptions.zorua-hisui: A once-departed soul, returned to life in Hisui. Derives power from resentment, which rises as energy atop its head and takes on the forms of foes. In this way, Zorua vents lingering malice.
descriptions.zoroark-hisui: With its disheveled white fur, it looks like an embodiment of death. Heedless of its own safety, Zoroark attacks its nemeses with a bitter energy so intense, it lacerates Zoroark's own body.
descriptions.deerling-summer: To prevent Deerling from entering their fields, many farmers will have several Lycanroc stand guard, as they are the natural enemy of Deerling.
descriptions.deerling-autumn: These Pokémon are not shy—they will behave as they please, even in front of people. If you feed one of them, it will quickly take a liking to you.
descriptions.deerling-winter: Deerling's scent changes with the seasons, but when the Pokémon is in its Winter Form, it has hardly any scent at all.
descriptions.sawsbuck-summer: There are many Sawsbuck enthusiasts. The thicker and larger the branches and leaves on its antlers, the more majestic the Sawsbuck is thought to be.
descriptions.sawsbuck-autumn: There are many Sawsbuck enthusiasts. The darker the red of the foliage that hangs from its antlers, the more stylish the Sawsbuck is thought to be.
descriptions.sawsbuck-winter: It's said that Sawsbuck are calm and easy to tame during the season when they take on this form, so it's the perfect time to make one your partner.
descriptions.stunfisk-galar: Living in mud with a high iron content has given it a strong steel body.
descriptions.braviary-hisui: Screaming a bloodcurdling battle cry, this huge and ferocious bird Pokémon goes out on the hunt. It blasts lakes with shock waves, then scoops up any prey that float to the water's surface.
descriptions.tornadus-therian: An example of what is known as a "form change," though I suspect this strange avian guise to be Tornadus's true form. Tornadus has been sighted crossing the ocean while in this form.
descriptions.thundurus-therian: Quick as a flash, it materializes out of nowhere. It pulverizes foes into nothingness with showers of devastatingly powerful lightning bolts launched from the string of orbs on its tail.
descriptions.landorus-therian: Landorus soars through the sky in this form, bestowing plentiful harvests upon the land and earning the people's reverence. It can traverse the whole of Hisui in a mere couple of hours.
descriptions.kyurem-white: It has foreseen that a world of truth will arrive for people and Pokémon. It strives to protect that future.
descriptions.kyurem-black: It's said that this Pokémon battles in order to protect the ideal world that will exist in the future for people and Pokémon.
descriptions.keldeo-resolute: Keldeo has strengthened its resolve for battle, filling its body with power and changing its form.
descriptions.vivillon-polar: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from snowy lands.
descriptions.vivillon-tundra: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands of severe cold.
descriptions.vivillon-continental: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands of vast space.
descriptions.vivillon-garden: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from verdant lands.
descriptions.vivillon-elegant: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands with distinct seasons.
descriptions.vivillon-meadow: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands where flowers bloom.
descriptions.vivillon-modern: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from sun-drenched lands.
descriptions.vivillon-marine: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands with ocean breezes.
descriptions.vivillon-archipelago: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from places with many islands.
descriptions.vivillon-highplains: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands with little rain.
descriptions.vivillon-sandstorm: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from parched lands.
descriptions.vivillon-river: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands where large rivers flow.
descriptions.vivillon-monsoon: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands with intense rainfall.
descriptions.vivillon-savanna: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands with a tropical climate.
descriptions.vivillon-sun: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands bathed in light.
descriptions.vivillon-ocean: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands of perpetual summer.
descriptions.vivillon-jungle: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands of tropical rain forests.
descriptions.vivillon-fancy: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from a mysterious land.
descriptions.vivillon-pokeball: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from a special land.
descriptions.flabebe-yellow: This Flabébé rides a yellow flower. The Pokémon is defenseless and vulnerable before it has found and received power from a flower.
descriptions.flabebe-orange: This Flabébé rides an orange flower. On its head, it wears a crown of pollen that has healing properties.
descriptions.flabebe-blue: Once it finds a flower it likes, this Pokémon will spend the rest of its life taking care of its flower. This Flabébé rides a blue flower.
descriptions.flabebe-white: This Flabébé rides a white flower. The wind blows this Pokémon around as it drifts in search of flower gardens.
descriptions.floette-yellow: This Pokémon can draw forth the power hidden within yellow flowers. This power then becomes the moves Floette uses to protect itself.
descriptions.floette-orange: This Pokémon can draw forth the most power when in sync with orange flowers, compared to flowers of other colors.
descriptions.floette-blue: Whenever this Pokémon finds flowering plants that are withering, it will bring them back to its territory and care for them until they are healthy.
descriptions.floette-white: Floette that are fond of white flowers can also easily sync with flowers of other colors.
descriptions.floette-eternal: Terrifying energy is concealed within its ominous flower, but Floette still swings it about innocently.
descriptions.florges-yellow: It is said that there was once a Florges that protected the garden of a castle for over 300 years.
descriptions.florges-orange: Its orange flowers fire off powerful beams, attacking as if they were a battery of artillery.
descriptions.florges-blue: Though usually compassionate, Florges will hunt down anyone who vandalizes its flower garden, showing no mercy even if they beg for their lives.
descriptions.florges-white: A flower garden made by a white-flowered Florges will be beautifully decorated with flowering plants of many different colors.
descriptions.furfrou-heart: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou's fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptions.furfrou-star: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou's fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptions.furfrou-diamond: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou's fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptions.furfrou-debutante: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou's fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptions.furfrou-matron: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou's fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptions.furfrou-dandy: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou's fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptions.furfrou-lareine: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou's fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptions.furfrou-kabuki: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou's fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptions.furfrou-pharaoh: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou's fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptions.meowstic-f: Females are a bit more selfish and aggressive than males. If they don't get what they want, they will torment you with their psychic abilities.
descriptions.aegislash-blade: This stance is dedicated to offense. It can cleave any opponent with the strength and weight of its steel blade.
descriptions.sliggoo-hisui: A creature given to melancholy. I suspect its metallic shell developed as a result of the mucus on its skin reacting with the iron in Hisui's water.
descriptions.goodra-hisui: Able to freely control the hardness of its metallic shell. It loathes solitude and is extremely clingy—it will fume and run riot if those dearest to it ever leave its side.
descriptions.pumpkaboo-small: When taking spirits to the afterlife, small Pumpkaboo prefer the spirits of children to those of adults.
descriptions.pumpkaboo-large: When taking spirits to the afterlife, large Pumpkaboo prefer the spirits of adults to those of children.
descriptions.pumpkaboo-super: Supersized Pumpkaboo are very partial to the spirits of people who were of similarly superior proportions.
descriptions.gourgeist-small: Small Gourgeist pretend to be children to fool adults. Anyone who falls for the act gets carried away to the hereafter.
descriptions.gourgeist-large: Large Gourgeist put on the guise of adults, taking the hands of children to lead them to the afterlife.
descriptions.gourgeist-super: Supersized Gourgeist aren't picky. They will forcefully drag anyone off to the afterlife.
descriptions.avalugg-hisui: The armor of ice covering its lower jaw puts steel to shame and can shatter rocks with ease. This Pokémon barrels along steep mountain paths, cleaving through the deep snow.
descriptions.xerneas-active: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.
descriptions.zygarde-10: Born when around 10% of Zygarde's cells have been gathered from all over, this form is skilled in close-range combat.
descriptions.zygarde-10c: Born when around 10% of Zygarde's cells have been gathered from all over, this form is skilled in close-range combat.
descriptions.zygarde-50c: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.
descriptions.zygarde-complete: Born when all of Zygarde's cells have been gathered together, it uses force to neutralize those who harm the ecosystem.
descriptions.hoopa-unbound: In its true form, it possesses a huge amount of power. Legends of its avarice tell how it once carried off an entire castle to gain the treasure hidden within.
descriptions.decidueye-hisui: The air stored inside the rachises of Decidueye's feathers insulates the Pokémon against Hisui's extreme cold. This is firm proof that evolution can be influenced by environment.
descriptions.oricorio-pompom: This Oricorio has drunk bright yellow nectar. When it sees someone looking glum, it will try to cheer them up with a dance.
descriptions.oricorio-pau: This Oricorio has sipped pink nectar. It gets so caught up in its dancing that it sometimes doesn't hear its Trainer's orders.
descriptions.oricorio-sensu: This Oricorio has sipped purple nectar. Some dancers use its graceful, elegant dancing as inspiration.
descriptions.rockruff-dusk: This Pokémon can bond very strongly with its Trainer, but it also has a habit of biting. Raising a Rockruff for a long time can be challenging.
descriptions.lycanroc-midnight: They live alone without forming packs. They will only listen to orders from Trainers who can draw out their true power.
descriptions.lycanroc-dusk: Bathed in the setting sun of evening, Lycanroc has undergone a special kind of evolution. An intense fighting spirit underlies its calmness.
descriptions.wishiwashi-school: Called "demon of the sea" by some, when Wishiwashi are injured in battle and their numbers dwindle, they become a regular school.
descriptions.silvally-fighting: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-flying: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-poison: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-ground: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-rock: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-bug: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-ghost: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-steel: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-fire: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-water: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-grass: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-electric: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-psychic: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-ice: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-dragon: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-dark: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-fairy: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.minior-meteor: This Pokémon is born in the ozone layer. It falls to the ground once the outer shell enclosing its core grows heavy.
descriptions.minior-orange: This is its form when its shell has fallen off. The color of its core depends on the materials that made up the food it ate.
descriptions.minior-yellow: This is its form when its shell has fallen off. The color of its core depends on the materials that made up the food it ate.
descriptions.minior-green: This is its form when its shell has fallen off. The color of its core depends on the materials that made up the food it ate.
descriptions.minior-blue: This is its form when its shell has fallen off. The color of its core depends on the materials that made up the food it ate.
descriptions.minior-indigo: This is its form when its shell has fallen off. The color of its core depends on the materials that made up the food it ate.
descriptions.minior-violet: This is its form when its shell has fallen off. The color of its core depends on the materials that made up the food it ate.
descriptions.mimikyu-busted: Sad that its true identity may be exposed, Mimikyu will mercilessly seek revenge on any opponent that breaks its neck.
descriptions.necrozma-duskmane: This is Necrozma's form while it's absorbing the power of Solgaleo, making it extremely ferocious and impossible to control.
descriptions.necrozma-dawnwings: This is its form while it's devouring the light of Lunala. It grasps foes in its giant claws and rips them apart with brute force.
descriptions.necrozma-ultra: The light pouring out from all over its body affects living things and nature, impacting them in various ways.
descriptions.magearna-original: It functions thanks to its artificial soul. The vivid decoration is proof that it was presented as a gift to royalty.
descriptions.melmetal-gmax: In a distant land, there are legends about a cyclopean giant. In fact, the giant was a Melmetal that was flooded with Gigantamax energy.
descriptions.rillaboom-gmax: Gigantamax energy has caused Rillaboom's stump to grow into a drum set that resembles a forest.
descriptions.cinderace-gmax: Infused with Cinderace's fighting spirit, the gigantic Pyro Ball never misses its targets and completely roasts opponents.
descriptions.inteleon-gmax: Gigantamax Inteleon's Water Gun move fires at Mach 7. As the Pokémon takes aim, it uses the crest on its head to gauge wind and temperature.
descriptions.corviknight-gmax: Imbued with Gigantamax energy, its wings can whip up winds more forceful than any a hurricane could muster. The gusts blow everything away.
descriptions.orbeetle-gmax: Its brain has grown to a gargantuan size, as has the rest of its body. This Pokémon's intellect and psychic abilities are overpowering.
descriptions.drednaw-gmax: It responded to Gigantamax energy by becoming bipedal. First it comes crashing down on foes, and then it finishes them off with its massive jaws.
descriptions.coalossal-gmax: Its body is a colossal stove. With Gigantamax energy stoking the fire, this Pokémon's flame burns hotter than 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
descriptions.flapple-gmax: Under the influence of Gigantamax energy, it produces much more sweet nectar, and its shape has changed to resemble a giant apple.
descriptions.appletun-gmax: It blasts its opponents with massive amounts of sweet, sticky nectar, drowning them under the deluge.
descriptions.sandaconda-gmax: Its sand pouch has grown to tremendous proportions. More than 1,000,000 tons of sand now swirl around its body.
descriptions.cramorant-gulping: Cramorant's gluttony led it to try to swallow an Arrokuda whole, which in turn led to Cramorant getting an Arrokuda stuck in its throat.
descriptions.cramorant-gorging: This Cramorant has accidentally gotten a Pikachu lodged in its gullet. Cramorant is choking a little, but it isn't really bothered.
descriptions.toxtricity-lowkey: Capable of generating 15,000 volts of electricity, this Pokémon looks down on all that would challenge it.
descriptions.toxtricity-gmax: Its excessive electric energy is its weapon. This Pokémon can build up more electricity than any thundercloud.
descriptions.centiskorch-gmax: Gigantamax energy has evoked a rise in its body temperature, now reaching over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. Its heat waves incinerate its enemies.
descriptions.sinistea-antique: The swirl pattern in this Pokémon's body is its weakness. If it gets stirred, the swirl loses its shape, and Sinistea gets dizzy.
descriptions.polteageist-antique: Trainers Polteageist trusts will be allowed to experience its distinctive flavor and aroma firsthand by sampling just a tiny bit of its tea.
descriptions.hatterene-gmax: This Pokémon can read the emotions of creatures over 30 miles away. The minute it senses hostility, it goes on the attack.
descriptions.grimmsnarl-gmax: By transforming its leg hair, this Pokémon delivers power-packed drill kicks that can bore huge holes in Galar's terrain.
descriptions.alcremie-rubycream: The moment it evolved, it took on a sweet and tart flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
descriptions.alcremie-matchacream: The moment it evolved, it took on an aromatic flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
descriptions.alcremie-mintcream: The moment it evolved, it took on a refreshing flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
descriptions.alcremie-lemoncream: The moment it evolved, it took on a sour flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
descriptions.alcremie-saltedcream: The moment it evolved, it took on a salty flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
descriptions.alcremie-rubyswirl: The moment it evolved, it took on a mixed flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
descriptions.alcremie-caramelswirl: The moment it evolved, it took on a bitter flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
descriptions.alcremie-rainbowswirl: The moment it evolved, it took on a complex flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
descriptions.alcremie-gmax: Cream pours endlessly from this Pokémon's body. The cream stiffens when compressed by an impact. A harder impact results in harder cream.
descriptions.eiscue-noiceface: The ice covering this Pokémon's face has shattered, revealing a slightly worried expression that many people are enamored with.
descriptions.indeedee-f: These intelligent Pokémon touch horns with each other to share information between them.
descriptions.morpeko-hangry: Intense hunger drives it to extremes of violence, and the electricity in its cheek sacs has converted into a Dark-type energy.
descriptions.copperajah-gmax: So much power is packed within its trunk that if it were to unleash that power, the resulting blast could level mountains and change the landscape.
descriptions.duraludon-gmax: It's grown to resemble a skyscraper. Parts of its towering body glow due to a profusion of energy.
descriptions.zacian-crowned: Now armed with a weapon it used in ancient times, this Pokémon needs only a single strike to fell even Gigantamax Pokémon.
descriptions.zamazenta-crowned: Its ability to deflect any attack led to it being known as the Fighting Master's Shield. It was feared and respected by all.
descriptions.eternatus-eternamax: As a result of Rose's meddling, Eternatus absorbed all the energy in the Galar region. It's now in a state of power overload.
descriptions.urshifu-rapidstrike: It's believed that this Pokémon modeled its fighting style on the flow of a river—sometimes rapid, sometimes calm.
descriptions.urshifu-gmax: People call it the embodiment of rage. It's said that this Pokémon's terrifying expression and shout will rid the world of malevolence.
descriptions.urshifu-rapidstrikegmax: As it waits for the right moment to unleash its Gigantamax power, this Pokémon maintains a perfect one-legged stance. It won't even twitch.
descriptions.zarude-dada: This Zarude left its pack to raise a human child. The cloth Zarude would wrap the child with has a comforting scent that calmed the child's crying.
descriptions.calyrex-ice: According to lore, this Pokémon showed no mercy to those who got in its way, yet it would heal its opponents' wounds after battle.
descriptions.calyrex-shadow: It's said that Calyrex and a Pokémon that had bonded with it ran all across the Galar region to bring green to the wastelands.
descriptions.ursaluna-bloodmoon: It crossed the sea and drifted ashore in a new land. Surviving in this place led it to take on a unique appearance and gain special powers.
descriptions.basculegion-f: The souls of its comrades cloak its body and propel it effortlessly through even raging rapids.
descriptions.enamorus-therian: A different guise from its feminine humanoid form. From the clouds, it descends upon those who treat any form of life with disrespect and metes out wrathful, ruthless punishment.
descriptions.oinkologne-f: This Pokémon sends a flowerlike scent wafting about. Well-developed muscles in its legs allow it to leap more than 16 feet with no trouble at all.
descriptions.maushold-four: The two little ones just appeared one day. The group might be a family of related Pokémon, but nobody knows for sure.
descriptions.squawkabilly-blue: The largest of their flocks can contain more than 50 individuals. They fly around towns and forests, searching for food and making a racket.
descriptions.squawkabilly-yellow: These Squawkabilly are hotheaded, and their fighting style is vicious. They'll leap within reach of their foes to engage in close combat.
descriptions.squawkabilly-white: This Pokémon dislikes being alone. It has a strong sense of community and survives by cooperating with allies.
descriptions.palafin-hero: This Pokémon's ancient genes have awakened. It is now so extraordinarily strong that it can easily lift a cruise ship with one fin.
descriptions.tatsugiri-droopy: This species' differing colors and patterns are apparently the result of Tatsugiri changing itself to suit the preferences of the prey it lures in.
descriptions.tatsugiri-stretchy: Bird Pokémon are its main prey. This Pokémon knows it's weak, so it hunts with a partner.
descriptions.dudunsparce-threesegment: The gentle Dudunsparce will put Pokémon that wander into its nest onto its back and carry them to the entrance.
descriptions.gimmighoul-roaming: This Pokémon was born from passion that seeped into a coin. It wanders, apparently seeking to return to the treasure chest it once inhabited.
descriptions.poltchageist-artisan: It sprinkles some of its powdery body onto food and drains the life-force from those who so much as lick it.
descriptions.sinistcha-masterpiece: It lives inside a superb teacup that was crafted by a potter of great renown. Collectors positively adore this Pokémon.
descriptions.ogerpon-wellspring: This form excels in both attack and defense. It ceaselessly unleashes moves like a spring gushes water.
descriptions.ogerpon-hearthflame: This form is the most aggressive, bombarding enemies with the intensity of flames blazing within a hearth.
descriptions.ogerpon-cornerstone: This form has excellent defenses, absorbing impacts solidly like the cornerstones that support houses.
descriptions.terapagos-terastal: Upon sensing danger, it prepares itself for battle by creating a sturdy shell of crystallized Terastal energy.
descriptions.terapagos-stellar: In this form, Terapagos resembles the world as the ancients saw it, and its Terastal energy is abnormally amplified.
descriptions.pikachu-alolabias: This Pokémon has electricity-storing pouches on its cheeks. These appear to become electrically charged during the night while Pikachu sleeps. It occasionally discharges electricity when it is dozy after waking up.
descriptions.exeggcute-alolabias: This Pokémon consists of six eggs that form a closely knit cluster. The six eggs attract each other and spin around. When cracks increasingly appear on the eggs, Exeggcute is close to evolution.
descriptions.cubone-alolabias: Cubone pines for the mother it will never see again. Seeing a likeness of its mother in the full moon, it cries. The stains on the skull the Pokémon wears are made by the tears it sheds.
descriptions.koffing-galarbias: Koffing embodies toxic substances. It mixes the toxins with raw garbage to set off a chemical reaction that results in a terribly powerful poison gas. The higher the temperature, the more gas is concocted by this Pokémon.
descriptions.cyndaquil-hisuibias: Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the Pokémon is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.
descriptions.quilava-hisuibias: Quilava keeps its foes at bay with the intensity of its flames and gusts of superheated air. This Pokémon applies its outstanding nimbleness to dodge attacks even while scorching the foe with flames.
descriptions.pichu-alolabias: When Pichu plays with others, it may short out electricity with another Pichu, creating a shower of sparks. In that event, this Pokémon will begin crying, startled by the flash of sparks.
descriptions.mimejr-galarbias: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokémon.
descriptions.oshawott-hisuibias: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.
descriptions.dewott-hisuibias: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.
descriptions.petilil-hisuibias: Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas where Petilil live are known to be good for growing plants.
descriptions.rufflet-hisuibias: They will challenge anything, even strong opponents, without fear. Their frequent fights help them become stronger.
descriptions.goomy-hisuibias: It's covered in a slimy membrane that makes any punches or kicks slide off it harmlessly.
descriptions.bergmite-hisuibias: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.
descriptions.rowlet-hisuibias: It feels relaxed in tight, dark places and has been known to use its Trainer's pocket or bag as a nest.
descriptions.dartrix-hisuibias: Supremely sensitive to the presence of others, it can detect opponents standing behind it, flinging its sharp feathers to take them out.

abilities.embodyaspectcornerstone: Force Mémorielle - Masque de la Pierre

moves.desc: Le Pokémon utilise la Force Z pour cracher de longs fils de soie et enserrer l'adversaire. La puissance varie selon celle de la capacité originale.

items.leek_and_potato_stew: Ragoût de poireau et pomme de terre

item_descs.blue_mint_leaf: Capable d'influencer la Défense d'un Pokémon
item_descs.cyan_mint_leaf: Capable d'influencer l'Attaque Spéciale d'un Pokémon
item_descs.pink_mint_leaf: Capable d'influencer la Défense Spéciale d'un Pokémon
item_descs.green_mint_leaf: Capable d'influencer la Vitesse d'un Pokémon
item_descs.white_mint_leaf: Capable de neutraliser la nature d'un Pokémon
item_descs.safari_ball: Taux de capture ×1,5 en dehors d'un combat
item_descs.fast_ball: Taux de capture ×4 sur un Pokémon avec une vitesse de base de 100 ou plus
item_descs.level_ball: Taux de capture ×1 à ×4, augmente lorsque le niveau du Pokémon du joueur est plus élevé que celui de la cible
item_descs.lure_ball: Taux de capture ×2 sur un Pokémon de type Eau, jusqu'à ce que la pêche soit ajoutée
item_descs.heavy_ball: Taux de capture ×1 à ×4, augmente selon la masse de la cible
item_descs.love_ball: Taux de capture ×2,5 si la cible est du genre opposé du Pokémon du joueur, ×8 s'ils sont aussi de la même espèce
item_descs.friend_ball: Taux de capture ×1, le Pokémon attrapé commencera avec 150 de Bonheur
item_descs.moon_ball: Taux de capture ×1 à ×4, augmente durant la nuit en fonction de la proximité de la pleine lune
item_descs.net_ball: Taux de capture ×3 sur un Pokémon de type Eau ou Insecte
item_descs.dive_ball: Taux de capture ×3,5 sur un Pokémon submergé sous l'eau
item_descs.nest_ball: Taux de capture ×1 à ×4, selon le niveau de la cible en allant du niveau 30 à 1
item_descs.repeat_ball: Taux de capture ×1, jusqu'à ce que le Pokédex soit ajouté
item_descs.timer_ball: Taux de capture ×1 à ×4, augmente à chaque tour passé, jusqu'au tour 10
item_descs.luxury_ball: Taux de capture ×1, le Pokémon attrapé gagne du Bonheur deux fois plus rapidement
item_descs.dusk_ball: Taux de capture ×3 si la cible est dans un niveau de lumière de 0, ×1,5 dans un niveau de lumière de 1 à 7
item_descs.heal_ball: Taux de capture ×1, restaure tous les PV, PP et les changements de statut lors de la capture
item_descs.quick_ball: Taux de capture ×5 au premier tour du combat
item_descs.park_ball: Taux de capture ×2,5 dans tous les biomes Forêt et Plaines
item_descs.dream_ball: Taux de capture ×4 sur un Pokémon endormi
item_descs.beast_ball: Taux de capture ×5 sur les Ultra-Chimères, sinon ×0,1
item_descs.ancient_feather_ball: Taux de capture ×1, vole plus loin
item_descs.ancient_wing_ball: Taux de capture ×1,5, vole plus loin
item_descs.ancient_jet_ball: Taux de capture ×2, vole plus loin
item_descs.ancient_heavy_ball: Taux de capture ×1, lance moins loin
item_descs.ancient_leaden_ball: Taux de capture ×1,5, lance moins loin
item_descs.ancient_gigaton_ball: Taux de capture ×2, lance moins loin

item_descs.smooth_rock: Étend la durée de la Tempête de sable
item_descs.icy_rock: Étend la durée de la Tempête de neige ou Grêle

item_descs.power_herb_1: Permet au porteur d’utiliser sans tour de charge une capacité qui nécessite un tour de charge
item_descs.destiny_knot: Si le porteur devient amoureux du Pokémon adverse, ce dernier devient également amoureux du porteur
item_descs.x_accuracy: Augmente temporairement la Précision de la cible d'un cran lorsque utilisé en combat
item_descs.heal_powder: Soigne toute altération de statut d'un Pokémon mais réduit son Bonheur
item_descs.pp_up: Augmente de 20 % les PP maximum d'une capacité d'un Pokémon jusqu'à un maximum d'augmentation de 60%
item_descs.power_bracer: Augmente de 8 les EVs d'Attaque lorsque de l'expérience est gagnée en combat
