descriptions.numel: Numel stores magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit within its body. If it gets wet, the magma cools and hardens. In that event, the Pokémon's body grows heavy and its movements become sluggish.
descriptions.camerupt: The humps on Camerupt's back are formed by a transformation of its bones. They sometimes blast out molten magma. This Pokémon apparently erupts often when it is enraged.
descriptions.torkoal: Torkoal generates energy by burning coal. It grows weaker as the fire dies down. When it is preparing for battle, this Pokémon burns more coal.
descriptions.spoink: Spoink keeps a pearl on top of its head. The pearl functions to amplify this Pokémon's psychokinetic powers. It is therefore on a constant search for a bigger pearl.
descriptions.grumpig: Grumpig uses the black pearls on its body to wield its fantastic powers. When it is doing so, it dances bizarrely. This Pokémon's black pearls are valuable as works of art.
descriptions.spinda: No two Spinda are said to have identical spot patterns on their hides. This Pokémon moves in a curious manner as if it is stumbling in dizziness. Its lurching movements can cause the opponent to become confused.
descriptions.trapinch: Trapinch is a patient hunter. It digs an inescapable pit in a desert and waits for its prey to come tumbling down. This Pokémon can go a whole week without access to any water.
descriptions.vibrava: Vibrava's wings have not yet completed the process of growing. Rather than flying long distances, they are more useful for generating ultrasonic waves by vibrating.
descriptions.flygon: Flygon whips up a sandstorm by flapping its wings. The wings create a series of notes that sound like singing. Because the "singing" is the only thing that can be heard in a sandstorm, this Pokémon is said to be the desert spirit.
descriptions.cacnea: The more arid and harsh the environment, the more pretty and fragrant a flower Cacnea grows. This Pokémon battles by wildly swinging its thorny arms.
descriptions.cacturne: If a traveler is going through a desert in the thick of night, Cacturne will follow in a ragtag group. The Pokémon are biding their time, waiting for the traveler to tire and become incapable of moving.
descriptions.swablu: Swablu loves to make things clean. If it spots something dirty, it will wipe and polish it with its cottony wings. If its wings become dirty, this Pokémon finds a stream and showers itself.
descriptions.altaria: Altaria sings in a gorgeous soprano. Its wings are like cotton clouds. This Pokémon catches updrafts with its buoyant wings and soars way up into the wild blue yonder.
descriptions.zangoose: Zangoose usually stays on all fours, but when angered, it gets up on its hind legs and extends its claws. This Pokémon shares a bitter rivalry with Seviper that dates back over generations.
descriptions.seviper: Seviper's swordlike tail serves two purposes—it slashes foes and douses them with secreted poison. This Pokémon will not give up its long-running blood feud with Zangoose.
descriptions.lunatone: Lunatone becomes active around the time of the full moon. Instead of walking, it moves by floating in midair. The Pokémon's intimidating red eyes cause all those who see it to become transfixed with fear.
descriptions.solrock: Sunlight is the source of Solrock's power. It is said to possess the ability to read the emotions of others. This Pokémon gives off intense heat while rotating its body.
descriptions.barboach: Barboach's body is covered with a slimy film. If a foe grabs it, this Pokémon just slips out of the enemy's grip. This Pokémon grows weak if the slimy coating dries up.
descriptions.whiscash: If Whiscash goes on a wild rampage, it sets off a quake-like tremor with a radius of over three miles. This Pokémon has the ability to predict real earthquakes.
descriptions.corphish: Corphish catches prey with its sharp claws. It has no likes or dislikes when it comes to food—it will eat anything. This Pokémon has no trouble living in filthy water.
descriptions.crawdaunt: Crawdaunt molts (sheds) its shell regularly. Immediately after molting, its shell is soft and tender. Until the shell hardens, this Pokémon hides in its streambed burrow to avoid attack from its foes.
descriptions.baltoy: As soon as it spots others of its kind, Baltoy congregates with them and then begins crying noisily in unison. This Pokémon sleeps while cleverly balancing itself on its one foot.
descriptions.claydol: Claydol is an enigma that appeared from a clay statue made by an ancient civilization dating back 20,000 years. This Pokémon shoots beams from both its hands.
descriptions.lileep: Lileep is an ancient Pokémon that was regenerated from a fossil. It remains permanently anchored to a rock. From its immobile perch, this Pokémon intently scans for prey with its two eyes.
descriptions.cradily: Cradily's body serves as an anchor, preventing it from being washed away in rough seas. This Pokémon secretes a strong digestive fluid from its tentacles.
descriptions.anorith: Anorith is said to be a type of Pokémon predecessor, with eight wings at the sides of its body. This Pokémon swam in the primordial sea by undulating these eight wings.
descriptions.armaldo: Armaldo is a Pokémon species that became extinct in prehistoric times. This Pokémon is said to have walked on its hind legs, which would have been more convenient for life on land.
descriptions.feebas: While Feebas's body is in tatters, it has a hardy and tenacious life force that enables it to live anywhere. However, this Pokémon is also slow and dimwitted, making it an easy catch.
descriptions.milotic: Milotic live at the bottom of large lakes. When this Pokémon's body glows a vivid pink, it releases a pulsing wave of energy that brings soothing calm to troubled hearts.
descriptions.castform: Castform borrows the power of nature to transform itself into the guises of the sun, rain, and snow-clouds. This Pokémon's feelings change with the weather.
descriptions.castform-sunny: Castform changes to this form when it basks in bright sunlight. When you touch its glowing skin, it feels all dried out!
descriptions.castform-rainy: This is Castform's form when pelted by rain. In an experiment where it was placed in a shower, this Pokémon didn't change to this form.
descriptions.castform-snowy: This is Castform's form when caught in a hailstorm. Its whole body is chilled, and its skin is partially frozen!
descriptions.kecleon: Kecleon alters its body coloration to blend in with its surroundings, allowing it to sneak up on its prey unnoticed. Then it lashes out with its long, stretchy tongue to instantly ensnare the unsuspecting target.
descriptions.shuppet: Shuppet grows by feeding on dark emotions, such as vengefulness and envy, in the hearts of people. It roams through cities in search of grudges that taint people.
descriptions.banette: A cursed energy permeated the stuffing of a discarded and forgotten plush doll, giving it new life as Banette. The Pokémon's energy would escape if it were to ever open its mouth.
descriptions.banette-mega: Mega Evolution increases its vindictiveness, and the cursing power that was held back by its zipper comes spilling out.
descriptions.duskull: Duskull wanders lost among the deep darkness of midnight. There is an oft-told admonishment given to misbehaving children that this Pokémon will spirit away bad children who earn scoldings from their mothers.
descriptions.dusclops: Dusclops absorbs anything, however large the object may be. This Pokémon hypnotizes its foe by waving its hands in a macabre manner and by bringing its single eye to bear. The hypnotized foe is made to do Dusclops's bidding.
descriptions.tropius: Children of the southern tropics eat as snacks the fruit that grows in bunches around the neck of Tropius. This Pokémon flies by flapping the leaves on its back as if they were wings.
descriptions.chimecho: In high winds, Chimecho cries as it hangs from a tree branch or the eaves of a building using a suction cup on its head. This Pokémon plucks berries with its long tail and eats them.
descriptions.absol: Absol has the ability to foretell the coming of natural disasters. It lives in a harsh, rugged mountain environment. This Pokémon very rarely ventures down from the mountains.
descriptions.absol-mega: It converts the energy from Mega Evolution into an intimidating aura. Fainthearted people expire from shock at the sight of it.
descriptions.wynaut: Wynaut gather on moonlit nights to play by squeezing up against each other. By being squeezed, this Pokémon gains endurance and is trained to dole out powerful counterattacks.
descriptions.snorunt: Snorunt survives by eating only snow and ice. Old folklore claims that a house visited by this Pokémon is sure to prosper for many generations to come.
descriptions.glalie: Glalie has the ability to freely control ice. For example, it can instantly freeze its prey solid. After immobilizing its prey in ice, this Pokémon enjoys eating it in leisurely fashion.
descriptions.glalie-mega: The power of Mega Evolution was so strong that it smashed Glalie's jaw. Its inability to eat very well leaves Glalie irritated.
descriptions.spheal: Spheal always travels by rolling around on its ball-like body. When the season for ice floes arrives, this Pokémon can be seen rolling about on ice and crossing the sea.
descriptions.sealeo: Sealeo often balances and rolls things on the tip of its nose. While the Pokémon is rolling something, it checks the object's aroma and texture to determine whether it likes the object or not.
descriptions.walrein: Walrein swims all over in frigid seawater while crushing icebergs with its grand, imposing tusks. Its thick layer of blubber makes enemy attacks bounce off harmlessly.
descriptions.clamperl: Clamperl grows while being protected by its rock-hard shell. When its body becomes too large to fit inside the shell, it is sure evidence that this Pokémon is getting close to evolution.
descriptions.huntail: Huntail's tail is shaped like a fish. It uses the tail to attract prey, then swallows the prey whole with its large, gaping mouth. This Pokémon swims by wiggling its slender body like a snake.
descriptions.gorebyss: Although Gorebyss is the very picture of elegance and beauty while swimming, it is also cruel. When it spots prey, this Pokémon inserts its thin mouth into the prey's body and drains the prey of its body fluids.
descriptions.relicanth: Relicanth is a rare species that was discovered in deep-sea explorations. This Pokémon's body withstands the enormous water pressure of the ocean depths. Its body is covered in tough scales that are like craggy rocks.
descriptions.luvdisc: Luvdisc's heart-shaped body is a symbol of love and romance. It is said that any couple meeting this Pokémon is promised a loving relationship that never ends.
descriptions.bagon: Bagon harbors a never-ending dream of one day soaring high among the clouds. As if trying to dispel its frustration over its inability to fly, this Pokémon slams its hard head against huge rocks and shatters them into pebbles.
descriptions.shelgon: Covering Shelgon's body are outgrowths much like bones. The shell is very hard and bounces off enemy attacks. When awaiting evolution, this Pokémon hides away in a cavern.
descriptions.salamence: By evolving into Salamence, this Pokémon finally realizes its long-held dream of growing wings. To express its joy, it flies and wheels all over the sky while spouting flames from its mouth.
descriptions.salamence-mega: It puts its forelegs inside its shell to streamline itself for flight. Salamence flies at high speeds over all kinds of topographical features.
descriptions.beldum: Beldum keeps itself floating by generating a magnetic force that repels earth's natural magnetism. When it sleeps, this Pokémon anchors itself to a cliff using the hooks on its rear.
descriptions.metang: When two Beldum fuse together, Metang is formed. The brains of the Beldum are joined by a magnetic nervous system. This Pokémon turns its arms to the rear for traveling at high speed.
descriptions.metagross: Metagross is the result of two Metang achieving fusion. When hunting, this Pokémon pins the prey to the ground under its massive body. It then eats the helpless victim using the large mouth on its stomach.
descriptions.metagross-mega: When it knows it can't win, it digs the claws on its legs into its opponent and starts the countdown to a big explosion.
descriptions.regirock: Regirock's body is composed entirely of rocks. Recently, a study made the startling discovery that the rocks were all unearthed from different locations.
descriptions.regice: Regice cloaks itself with frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit. Things will freeze solid just by going near this Pokémon. Its icy body is so cold, it will not melt even if it is immersed in magma.
descriptions.registeel: Registeel was imprisoned by people in ancient times. The metal composing its body is thought to be a curious substance that is not of this earth.
descriptions.latias: Latias is highly intelligent and capable of understanding human speech. It is covered with a glass-like down. The Pokémon enfolds its body with its down and refracts light to alter its appearance.
descriptions.latios: Latios will only open its heart to a Trainer with a compassionate spirit. This Pokémon can fly faster than a jet plane by folding its forelegs to minimize air resistance.
descriptions.kyogre: Kyogre is said to be the personification of the sea itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Groudon, as each sought to gain the power of nature.
descriptions.kyogre-primal: Through Primal Reversion and with nature's full power, it will take back its true form. It can summon storms that cause the sea levels to rise.
descriptions.groudon: Groudon is said to be the personification of the land itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Kyogre, as each sought to gain the power of nature.
descriptions.groudon-primal: Through Primal Reversion and with nature's full power, it will take back its true form. It can cause magma to erupt and expand the landmass of the world.
descriptions.rayquaza: Rayquaza is said to have lived for hundreds of millions of years. Legends remain of how it put to rest the clash between Kyogre and Groudon.
descriptions.rayquaza-mega: It flies forever through the ozone layer, consuming meteoroids for sustenance. The many meteoroids in its body provide the energy it needs to Mega Evolve.
descriptions.jirachi: Jirachi will awaken from its sleep of a thousand years if you sing to it in a voice of purity. It is said to make true any wish that people desire.
descriptions.deoxys: Deoxys emerged from a virus that came from space. It is highly intelligent and wields psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon shoots lasers from the crystalline organ on its chest.
descriptions.turtwig: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.
descriptions.grotle: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.
descriptions.torterra: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.
descriptions.chimchar: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.
descriptions.monferno: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.
descriptions.infernape: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.
descriptions.piplup: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.
descriptions.prinplup: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees.
descriptions.empoleon: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.
descriptions.starly: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.
descriptions.staravia: It lives in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.
descriptions.staraptor: When Staravia evolve into Staraptor, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.
descriptions.bidoof: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.
descriptions.bibarel: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.
descriptions.kricketot: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.
descriptions.kricketune: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.
descriptions.shinx: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.
descriptions.luxio: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.
descriptions.luxray: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.
descriptions.budew: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.
descriptions.roserade: With the movements of a dancer, it strikes with whips that are densely lined with poison thorns.
descriptions.cranidos: A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million years ago, it would snap obstructing trees with headbutts.
descriptions.rampardos: Its skull is as hard as iron. It is a brute that tears down jungle trees while catching prey.
descriptions.shieldon: It was generated from a fossil dug out of a layer of clay that was older than anyone knows. It has a sturdy face.
descriptions.bastiodon: Any frontal attack is repulsed. It is a docile Pokémon that feeds on grass and berries.
descriptions.burmy: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.
descriptions.burmy-sandy: It creates a cloak by weaving together sand, mud, and silk it has spat out. This earthen cloak is ruined by wind and rain, so the Pokémon hides away in caves and other such places.
descriptions.burmy-trash: When confronted by a lack of other materials, Burmy will create its cloak using dust and refuse. The cloak seems to be more comfortable than one would think.
descriptions.wormadam: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon's body. The cloak is never shed.
descriptions.wormadam-sandy: Its earthen skin is reasonably hard—it has no problem repelling a Starly's pecking, at least.
descriptions.wormadam-trash: Its body, composed of refuse, blends in to the scenery so much as to be inconspicuous. This seems to be the perfect way for the Pokémon to evade the detection of predators.
descriptions.mothim: It flutters around at night and steals honey from the Combee hive.
descriptions.combee: It collects and delivers honey to its colony. At night, they cluster to form a beehive and sleep.
descriptions.vespiquen: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by Combee.
descriptions.pachirisu: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.
descriptions.buizel: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.
descriptions.floatzel: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.
descriptions.cherubi: It evolves by sucking the energy out of the small ball where it had been storing nutrients.
descriptions.cherrim: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun's rays with its whole body.
descriptions.cherrim-sunshine: After absorbing plenty of sunlight, Cherrim takes this form. It's full of energy while it's like this, and its liveliness will go on until sundown.
descriptions.shellos: Its shape and coloration vary, depending on its habitat.
descriptions.shellos-east: Scientists interested in its great regenerative capabilities are currently analyzing the materials from which its cells are made.
descriptions.gastrodon: It apparently had a huge shell for protection in ancient times. It lives in shallow tidal pools.
descriptions.gastrodon-east: A relative of Shellder and Cloyster, this ocean dweller sometimes comes onto land in search of food.
descriptions.ambipom: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.
descriptions.drifloon: These Pokémon are called the "Signpost for Wandering Spirits." Children holding them sometimes vanish.
descriptions.drifblim: It's drowsy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.
descriptions.buneary: When it senses danger, it perks up its ears. On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into its fur.
descriptions.lopunny: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.
descriptions.lopunny-mega: Mega Evolution awakens its combative instincts. It has shed any fur that got in the way of its attacks.
descriptions.mismagius: Its cries sound like incantations to torment the foe. It appears where you least expect it.
descriptions.honchkrow: Becoming active at night, it is known to swarm with numerous Murkrow in tow.
descriptions.glameow: When it's happy, Glameow demonstrates beautiful movements of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.
descriptions.purugly: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.
descriptions.chingling: There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops, the orb bounces all over and makes a ringing sound.
descriptions.stunky: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.
descriptions.skuntank: It sprays a stinky fluid from its tail. The fluid smells worse the longer it is allowed to fester.
descriptions.bronzor: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.
descriptions.bronzong: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.
descriptions.bonsly: It prefers an arid atmosphere. It leaks water that looks like tears when adjusting its moisture level.
descriptions.mimejr: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokémon.
descriptions.happiny: It carefully carries a round, white rock that it thinks is an egg. It's bothered by how curly its hair looks.
descriptions.chatot: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.
descriptions.spiritomb: It was bound to a fissure in an odd keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.
descriptions.gible: It nests in small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.
descriptions.gabite: As it digs to expand its nest, it habitually digs up gems that it then hoards in its nest.
descriptions.garchomp: It flies at speeds equal to a jet fighter plane. It never allows its prey to escape.
descriptions.garchomp-mega: Its disposition is more vicious than before its Mega Evolution. Garchomp carves its opponents up with the scythes on both arms.
descriptions.munchlax: It conceals food under the long fur on its body. It carts around this food stash and swallows it without chewing.
descriptions.riolu: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.
descriptions.lucario: By reading the auras of all things, it can tell how others are feeling from over half a mile away.
descriptions.lucario-mega: Bathed in explosive energy, its combative instincts have awakened. For its enemies, it has no mercy whatsoever.
descriptions.hippopotas: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.
descriptions.hippowdon: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.
descriptions.skorupi: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.
descriptions.drapion: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.
descriptions.croagunk: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.
descriptions.toxicroak: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.
descriptions.carnivine: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.
descriptions.finneon: After long exposure to sunlight, the patterns on its tail fins shine vividly when darkness arrives.
descriptions.lumineon: To avoid detection by predators, it crawls along the seafloor using the two fins on its chest.
descriptions.mantyke: When it swims close to the surface of the ocean, people aboard ships are able to observe the pattern on its back.
descriptions.snover: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.
descriptions.abomasnow: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.
descriptions.weavile: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.
descriptions.magnezone: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.
descriptions.lickilicky: Their saliva contains lots of components that can dissolve anything. The numbness caused by their lick does not dissipate.
descriptions.rhyperior: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.
descriptions.tangrowth: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can't even see its eyes.
descriptions.electivire: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.
descriptions.magmortar: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit out of its arms. Its breath also sears and sizzles.
descriptions.togekiss: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another's rights and avoid needless strife.
descriptions.yanmega: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.
descriptions.leafeon: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.
descriptions.glaceon: It lowers its body heat to freeze its fur. The hairs then become like needles it can fire.
descriptions.gliscor: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.
descriptions.mamoswine: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.
descriptions.porygonz: Its programming was modified to enable it to travel through alien dimensions. Seems there might have been an error...
descriptions.gallade: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.
descriptions.probopass: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.
descriptions.dusknoir: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.
descriptions.froslass: Legends in snowy regions say that a woman who was lost on an icy mountain was reborn as Froslass.
descriptions.rotom: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.
descriptions.rotom-heat: This Rotom has possessed a convection microwave oven that uses a special motor. It also has a flair for manipulating flames.
descriptions.rotom-wash: This form of Rotom enjoys coming up with water- based pranks. Be careful with it if you don't want your room flooded.
descriptions.rotom-frost: Rotom assumes this form when it takes over a refrigerator powered by a special motor. It battles by spewing cold air.
descriptions.rotom-fan: In this form, Rotom applies its new power over wind to its love of pranks. It will happily blow away any important documents it can find.
descriptions.rotom-mow: This is Rotom after it's seized control of a lawn mower that has a special motor. As it mows down grass, it scatters the clippings everywhere.
descriptions.uxie: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.
descriptions.mesprit: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake's surface.
descriptions.azelf: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf all came from the same egg.
descriptions.dialga: A Pokémon spoken of in legend. It is said that time began moving when Dialga was born.
descriptions.dialga-origin: Radiant light caused Dialga to take on a form bearing a striking resemblance to the creator Pokémon. Dialga now wields such colossal strength that one must conclude this is its true form.
descriptions.palkia: It is said to live in a gap in the spatial dimension parallel to ours. It appears in mythology.
descriptions.palkia-origin: It soars across the sky in a form that greatly resembles the creator of all things. Perhaps this imitation of appearance is Palkia's strategy for gaining Arceus's powers.
descriptions.heatran: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.
descriptions.regigigas: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.
descriptions.giratina: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.
descriptions.giratina-origin: Giratina loses its legs upon changing into this form. I believe this Pokémon must hail from a world where the heavens and the earth are as one, though I have no way of proving it.
descriptions.cresselia: Those who sleep holding Cresselia's feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
descriptions.phione: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.
descriptions.manaphy: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.
descriptions.darkrai: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.
descriptions.shaymin: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.
descriptions.shaymin-sky: Upon taking in the scent of a particular rare flower, Shaymin is enveloped in light, and its tiny body transforms. I took a whiff of the flower myself, but alas, my body remained unchanged.
descriptions.arceus: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-fighting: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-flying: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-poison: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-ground: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-rock: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-bug: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-ghost: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-steel: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-fire: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-water: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-grass: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-electric: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-psychic: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-ice: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-dragon: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-dark: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.arceus-fairy: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
descriptions.victini: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being's entire body will be overflowing with power.
descriptions.snivy: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.
descriptions.servine: When it gets dirty, its leaves can't be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.
descriptions.serperior: It can stop its opponents' movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.
descriptions.tepig: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.
descriptions.pignite: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.
descriptions.emboar: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.
descriptions.oshawott: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.
descriptions.dewott: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.
descriptions.samurott: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.
descriptions.samurott-hisui: Hard of heart and deft of blade, this rare form of Samurott is a product of the Pokémon's evolution in the region of Hisui. Its turbulent blows crash into foes like ceaseless pounding waves.
descriptions.patrat: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won't notice a foe coming from behind.
descriptions.watchog: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.
descriptions.lillipup: Though it is a very brave Pokémon, it's also smart enough to check its foe's strength and avoid battle.
descriptions.herdier: It has black, cape-like fur that is very hard and decreases the amount of damage it receives.
descriptions.stoutland: Being wrapped in its long fur is so comfortable that a person would be fine even overnight on a wintry mountain.
descriptions.purrloin: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can't help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.
descriptions.liepard: Stealthily, it sneaks up on its target, striking from behind before its victim has a chance to react.
descriptions.pansage: It's good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It's kind enough to share them with friends.
descriptions.simisage: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.
descriptions.pansear: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.
descriptions.simisear: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.
descriptions.panpour: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.
descriptions.simipour: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.
descriptions.munna: It eats the dreams of people and Pokémon. When it eats a pleasant dream, it expels pink-colored mist.
descriptions.musharna: The dream mist coming from its forehead changes into many different colors depending on the dream that was eaten.
descriptions.pidove: These Pokémon live in cities. They are accustomed to people. Flocks often gather in parks and plazas.
descriptions.tranquill: No matter where in the world it goes, it knows where its nest is, so it never gets separated from its Trainer.
descriptions.unfezant: Males have plumage on their heads. They will never let themselves feel close to anyone other than their Trainers.
descriptions.blitzle: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.
descriptions.zebstrika: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.
descriptions.roggenrola: They were discovered a hundred years ago in an earthquake fissure. Inside each one is an energy core.
descriptions.boldore: When it is healthy, its core sticks out. Always facing the same way, it swiftly moves front to back and left to right.
descriptions.gigalith: Compressing the energy from its internal core lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away a mountain.
descriptions.woobat: The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a Woobat has been attached to it is said to bring good fortune.
descriptions.swoobat: Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.
descriptions.drilbur: By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the ground at a speed of 30 mph.
descriptions.excadrill: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.
descriptions.audino: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.
descriptions.timburr: Always carrying squared logs, they help out with construction. As they grow, they carry bigger logs.
descriptions.gurdurr: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.
descriptions.conkeldurr: Rather than rely on force, they master moves that utilize the centrifugal force of spinning concrete.
descriptions.tympole: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk.
descriptions.palpitoad: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.
descriptions.seismitoad: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.
descriptions.throh: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.
descriptions.sawk: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.
descriptions.sewaddle: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.
descriptions.swadloon: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.
descriptions.leavanny: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.
descriptions.venipede: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.
descriptions.whirlipede: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.
descriptions.scolipede: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.
descriptions.cottonee: Perhaps because they feel more at ease in a group, they stick to others they find. They end up looking like a cloud.
descriptions.whimsicott: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.
descriptions.petilil: Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas where Petilil live are known to be good for growing plants.
descriptions.lilligant: Even veteran Trainers face a challenge in getting its beautiful flower to bloom. This Pokémon is popular with celebrities.
descriptions.lilligant-hisui: I suspect that its well-developed legs are the result of a life spent on mountains covered in deep snow. The scent it exudes from its flower crown heartens those in proximity.
descriptions.basculin: Its temperament is vicious and aggressive. This Pokémon is also full of vitality and can multiply rapidly before anyone notices.
descriptions.basculin-bluestriped: These Pokémon form schools with others of the same color. The greatest foe of a school of blue Basculin is a school of red Basculin.
descriptions.basculin-white: They live in frigid seas, forming schools and sharing food among themselves. When the time comes, they return to the river they were born in.
descriptions.sandile: They live buried in the sands of the desert. The sun-warmed sands prevent their body temperature from dropping.
descriptions.krokorok: The special membrane covering its eyes can sense the heat of objects, so it can see its surroundings even in darkness.
descriptions.krookodile: They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.
descriptions.darumaka: When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.
descriptions.darumaka-galar: It lived in snowy areas for so long that its fire sac cooled off and atrophied. It now has an organ that generates cold instead.
descriptions.darmanitan: Its internal fire burns at 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.
descriptions.darmanitan-zen: Through meditation, it calms its raging spirit and hones its psychic powers.
descriptions.darmanitan-galar: On days when blizzards blow through, it comes down to where people live. It stashes food in the snowball on its head, taking it home for later.
descriptions.darmanitan-galarzen: Anger has reignited its atrophied flame sac. This Pokémon spews fire everywhere as it rampages indiscriminately.
descriptions.maractus: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.
descriptions.dwebble: When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes a liquid from its mouth to open up a hole to crawl into.
descriptions.crustle: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.
descriptions.scraggy: Proud of its sturdy skull, it suddenly headbutts everything, but its weight makes it unstable, too.
descriptions.scrafty: It can smash concrete blocks with its kicking attacks. The one with the biggest crest is the group leader.
descriptions.sigilyph: The guardians of an ancient city, they always fly the same route while keeping watch for invaders.
descriptions.yamask: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.
descriptions.yamask-galar: A clay slab with cursed engravings took possession of a Yamask. The slab is said to be absorbing the Yamask's dark power.
descriptions.cofagrigus: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.
descriptions.tirtouga: Restored from a fossil, this Pokémon can dive to depths beyond half a mile.
descriptions.carracosta: It could knock out a foe with a slap from one of its developed front appendages and chew it up, shell or bones and all.
descriptions.archen: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, they were unable to fly and moved about by hopping from one branch to another.
descriptions.archeops: It runs better than it flies. It takes off into the sky by running at a speed of 25 mph.
descriptions.trubbish: Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for a week. They prefer unsanitary places.
descriptions.garbodor: Consuming garbage makes new kinds of poison gases and liquids inside their bodies.
descriptions.garbodor-gmax: Due to Gigantamax energy, this Pokémon's toxic gas has become much thicker, congealing into masses shaped like discarded toys.
descriptions.zorua: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.
descriptions.zorua-hisui: A once-departed soul, returned to life in Hisui. Derives power from resentment, which rises as energy atop its head and takes on the forms of foes. In this way, Zorua vents lingering malice.
descriptions.zoroark: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.
descriptions.zoroark-hisui: With its disheveled white fur, it looks like an embodiment of death. Heedless of its own safety, Zoroark attacks its nemeses with a bitter energy so intense, it lacerates Zoroark's own body.
descriptions.minccino: These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.
descriptions.cinccino: Cinccino's body is coated in a special oil that helps it deflect attacks, such as punches.
descriptions.gothita: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.
descriptions.gothorita: According to many old tales, it creates friends for itself by controlling sleeping children on starry nights.
descriptions.gothitelle: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers' life spans.
descriptions.solosis: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.
descriptions.duosion: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.
descriptions.reuniclus: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.
descriptions.ducklett: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.
descriptions.swanna: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.
descriptions.vanillite: This Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. It sleeps buried in snow.
descriptions.vanillish: Snowy mountains are this Pokémon's habitat. During an ancient ice age, they moved to southern areas.
descriptions.vanilluxe: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make snow clouds inside their bodies and, when angry, cause violent blizzards.
descriptions.deerling: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon's fur. People use it to mark the seasons.
descriptions.deerling-summer: To prevent Deerling from entering their fields, many farmers will have several Lycanroc stand guard, as they are the natural enemy of Deerling.
descriptions.deerling-autumn: These Pokémon are not shy—they will behave as they please, even in front of people. If you feed one of them, it will quickly take a liking to you.
descriptions.deerling-winter: Deerling's scent changes with the seasons, but when the Pokémon is in its Winter Form, it has hardly any scent at all.
descriptions.sawsbuck: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.
descriptions.sawsbuck-summer: There are many Sawsbuck enthusiasts. The thicker and larger the branches and leaves on its antlers, the more majestic the Sawsbuck is thought to be.
descriptions.sawsbuck-autumn: There are many Sawsbuck enthusiasts. The darker the red of the foliage that hangs from its antlers, the more stylish the Sawsbuck is thought to be.
descriptions.sawsbuck-winter: It's said that Sawsbuck are calm and easy to tame during the season when they take on this form, so it's the perfect time to make one your partner.
descriptions.emolga: The energy made in its cheeks' electric pouches is stored inside its membrane and released while it is gliding.
descriptions.karrablast: For some reason they evolve when they receive electrical energy while they are attacking Shelmet.
descriptions.escavalier: These Pokémon evolve by wearing the shell covering of a Shelmet. The steel armor protects their whole body.
descriptions.foongus: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball, then releases poison spores.
descriptions.amoonguss: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.
descriptions.frillish: If its veil-like arms stun and wrap a foe, that foe will be dragged miles below the surface, never to return.
descriptions.jellicent: The fate of the ships and crew that wander into Jellicent's habitat: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.
descriptions.alomomola: It gently holds injured and weak Pokémon in its fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.
descriptions.joltik: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.
descriptions.galvantula: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.
descriptions.ferroseed: It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.
descriptions.ferrothorn: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.
descriptions.klink: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.
descriptions.klang: A minigear and big gear comprise its body. If the minigear it launches at a foe doesn't return, it will die.
descriptions.klinklang: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.
descriptions.tynamo: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.
descriptions.eelektrik: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.
descriptions.eelektross: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.
descriptions.elgyem: Rumors of its origin are linked to a UFO crash site in the desert 50 years ago.
descriptions.beheeyem: It uses psychic power to control an opponent's brain and tamper with its memories.
descriptions.litwick: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.
descriptions.lampent: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.
descriptions.chandelure: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.
descriptions.axew: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.
descriptions.fraxure: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.
descriptions.haxorus: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.
descriptions.cubchoo: Their snot is a barometer of health. When healthy, their snot is sticky and the power of their ice moves increases.
descriptions.beartic: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.
descriptions.cryogonal: They are composed of ice crystals. They capture prey with chains of ice, freezing the prey at -148 degrees Fahrenheit.
descriptions.shelmet: It evolves when bathed in an electric-like energy along with Karrablast. The reason is still unknown.
descriptions.accelgor: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.
descriptions.stunfisk: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.
descriptions.stunfisk-galar: Living in mud with a high iron content has given it a strong steel body.
descriptions.mienfoo: In fights, they dominate with onslaughts of flowing, continuous attacks. With their sharp claws, they cut enemies.
descriptions.mienshao: Using the long fur on its arms like whips, it launches into combo attacks that, once started, no one can stop.
descriptions.druddigon: It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no longer move.
descriptions.golett: Ancient science fashioned this Pokémon from clay. It's been active for thousands of years.
descriptions.golurk: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.
descriptions.pawniard: Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking the blades that cover their bodies into their prey.
descriptions.bisharp: Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard. Then Bisharp finishes off the prey.
descriptions.bouffalant: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.
descriptions.rufflet: They will challenge anything, even strong opponents, without fear. Their frequent fights help them become stronger.
descriptions.braviary: They fight for their friends without any thought about danger to themselves. One can carry a car while flying.
descriptions.braviary-hisui: Screaming a bloodcurdling battle cry, this huge and ferocious bird Pokémon goes out on the hunt. It blasts lakes with shock waves, then scoops up any prey that float to the water's surface.
descriptions.vullaby: Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly. They guard their posteriors with bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.
descriptions.mandibuzz: Watching from the sky, they swoop to strike weakened Pokémon on the ground. They decorate themselves with bones.
descriptions.heatmor: It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire, and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.
descriptions.durant: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.
descriptions.deino: Lacking sight, it's unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.
descriptions.zweilous: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.
descriptions.hydreigon: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!
descriptions.larvesta: The base of volcanoes is where they make their homes. They shoot fire from their five horns to repel attacking enemies.
descriptions.volcarona: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that Volcarona's fire provided a replacement for the sun.
descriptions.cobalion: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokémon.
descriptions.terrakion: Spoken of in legend, this Pokémon used its phenomenal power to destroy a castle in its effort to protect Pokémon.
descriptions.virizion: Legends say this Pokémon confounded opponents with its swift movements.
descriptions.tornadus: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.
descriptions.tornadus-therian: An example of what is known as a "form change," though I suspect this strange avian guise to be Tornadus's true form. Tornadus has been sighted crossing the ocean while in this form.
descriptions.thundurus: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.
descriptions.thundurus-therian: Quick as a flash, it materializes out of nowhere. It pulverizes foes into nothingness with showers of devastatingly powerful lightning bolts launched from the string of orbs on its tail.
descriptions.reshiram: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with fire. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.
descriptions.zekrom: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.
descriptions.landorus: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.
descriptions.landorus-therian: Landorus soars through the sky in this form, bestowing plentiful harvests upon the land and earning the people's reverence. It can traverse the whole of Hisui in a mere couple of hours.
descriptions.kyurem: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.
descriptions.kyurem-white: It has foreseen that a world of truth will arrive for people and Pokémon. It strives to protect that future.
descriptions.kyurem-black: It's said that this Pokémon battles in order to protect the ideal world that will exist in the future for people and Pokémon.
descriptions.keldeo: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.
descriptions.keldeo-resolute: Keldeo has strengthened its resolve for battle, filling its body with power and changing its form.
descriptions.meloetta: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.
descriptions.genesect: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.
descriptions.chespin: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn't faze it.
descriptions.quilladin: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won't start fights.
descriptions.chesnaught: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.
descriptions.fennekin: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.
descriptions.braixen: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.
descriptions.delphox: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.
descriptions.froakie: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.
descriptions.frogadier: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute's time.
descriptions.greninja: It appears and vanishes with a ninja's grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.
descriptions.bunnelby: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.
descriptions.diggersby: As powerful as an excavator, its ears can reduce dense bedrock to rubble. When it's finished digging, it lounges lazily.
descriptions.fletchling: Despite the beauty of its lilting voice, it's merciless to intruders that enter its territory.
descriptions.fletchinder: The hotter the flame sac on its belly, the faster it can fly, but it takes some time to get the fire going.
descriptions.talonflame: When attacking prey, it can reach speeds of up to 310 mph. It finishes its prey off with a colossal kick.
descriptions.scatterbug: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.
descriptions.spewpa: The beaks of bird Pokémon can't begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.
descriptions.vivillon: The patterns on this Pokémon's wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.
descriptions.vivillon-polar: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from snowy lands.
descriptions.vivillon-tundra: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands of severe cold.
descriptions.vivillon-continental: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands of vast space.
descriptions.vivillon-garden: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from verdant lands.
descriptions.vivillon-elegant: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands with distinct seasons.
descriptions.vivillon-meadow: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands where flowers bloom.
descriptions.vivillon-modern: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from sun-drenched lands.
descriptions.vivillon-marine: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands with ocean breezes.
descriptions.vivillon-archipelago: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from places with many islands.
descriptions.vivillon-highplains: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands with little rain.
descriptions.vivillon-sandstorm: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from parched lands.
descriptions.vivillon-river: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands where large rivers flow.
descriptions.vivillon-monsoon: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands with intense rainfall.
descriptions.vivillon-savanna: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands with a tropical climate.
descriptions.vivillon-sun: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands bathed in light.
descriptions.vivillon-ocean: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands of perpetual summer.
descriptions.vivillon-jungle: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands of tropical rain forests.
descriptions.vivillon-fancy: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from a mysterious land.
descriptions.vivillon-pokeball: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from a special land.
descriptions.litleo: They set off on their own from their pride and live by themselves to become stronger. These hot-blooded Pokémon are quick to fight.
descriptions.pyroar: With fiery breath of more than 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, they viciously threaten any challenger. The females protect the pride's cubs.
descriptions.flabebe: This Pokémon can draw forth the power hidden within blooming wild flowers. It is particularly fond of red flowers.
descriptions.flabebe-yellow: This Flabébé rides a yellow flower. The Pokémon is defenseless and vulnerable before it has found and received power from a flower.
descriptions.flabebe-orange: This Flabébé rides an orange flower. On its head, it wears a crown of pollen that has healing properties.
descriptions.flabebe-blue: Once it finds a flower it likes, this Pokémon will spend the rest of its life taking care of its flower. This Flabébé rides a blue flower.
descriptions.flabebe-white: This Flabébé rides a white flower. The wind blows this Pokémon around as it drifts in search of flower gardens.
descriptions.floette: This Pokémon draws forth what power is left in withered flowers to make them healthy again. It holds a red flower.
descriptions.floette-yellow: This Pokémon can draw forth the power hidden within yellow flowers. This power then becomes the moves Floette uses to protect itself.
descriptions.floette-orange: This Pokémon can draw forth the most power when in sync with orange flowers, compared to flowers of other colors.
descriptions.floette-blue: Whenever this Pokémon finds flowering plants that are withering, it will bring them back to its territory and care for them until they are healthy.
descriptions.floette-white: Floette that are fond of white flowers can also easily sync with flowers of other colors.
descriptions.floette-eternal: Terrifying energy is concealed within its ominous flower, but Floette still swings it about innocently.
descriptions.florges: This Pokémon creates an impressive flower garden in its territory. It draws forth the power of the red flowers around its neck.
descriptions.florges-yellow: It is said that there was once a Florges that protected the garden of a castle for over 300 years.
descriptions.florges-orange: Its orange flowers fire off powerful beams, attacking as if they were a battery of artillery.
descriptions.florges-blue: Though usually compassionate, Florges will hunt down anyone who vandalizes its flower garden, showing no mercy even if they beg for their lives.
descriptions.florges-white: A flower garden made by a white-flowered Florges will be beautifully decorated with flowering plants of many different colors.
descriptions.skiddo: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn't need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.
descriptions.gogoat: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.
descriptions.pancham: It does its level best to glare and pull a scary face, but it can't help grinning if anyone pats its head.
descriptions.pangoro: It charges ahead and bashes its opponents like a berserker, uncaring about any hits it might take. Its arms are mighty enough to snap a telephone pole.
descriptions.furfrou: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.
descriptions.furfrou-heart: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou's fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptions.furfrou-star: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou's fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptions.furfrou-diamond: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou's fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptions.furfrou-debutante: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou's fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptions.furfrou-matron: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou's fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptions.furfrou-dandy: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou's fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptions.furfrou-lareine: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou's fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptions.furfrou-kabuki: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou's fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptions.furfrou-pharaoh: There was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou's fur into the most exquisite style.
descriptions.espurr: It has enough psychic energy to blast everything within 300 feet of itself, but it has no control over its power.
descriptions.meowstic: The eyeball patterns on the interior of its ears emit psychic energy. It keeps the patterns tightly covered because that power is too immense.
descriptions.meowstic-f: Females are a bit more selfish and aggressive than males. If they don't get what they want, they will torment you with their psychic abilities.
descriptions.honedge: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person's arm and drains that person's life energy completely.
descriptions.doublade: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.
descriptions.aegislash: Apparently, it can detect the innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.
descriptions.aegislash-blade: This stance is dedicated to offense. It can cleave any opponent with the strength and weight of its steel blade.
descriptions.spritzee: In the past, rather than using perfume, royal ladies carried a Spritzee that would waft a fragrance they liked.
descriptions.aromatisse: Its scent is so overpowering that, unless a Trainer happens to really enjoy the smell, he or she will have a hard time walking alongside it.
descriptions.swirlix: Because it eats nothing but sweets, its fur is as sticky sweet as cotton candy.
descriptions.slurpuff: Its sense of smell is 100 million times better than a human's, so even the faintest scent tells it about everything in the area. It's like it can see with its nose!
descriptions.inkay: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent's will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.
descriptions.malamar: It lures its prey close with hypnotic motions, then wraps its tentacles around it before finishing it off with digestive fluids.
descriptions.binacle: They stretch and then contract, yanking their rocks along with them in bold hops. They eat seaweed that washes up on the shoreline.
descriptions.barbaracle: Barbaracle's legs and hands have minds of their own, and they will move independently. But they usually follow the head's orders.
descriptions.skrelp: It looks just like rotten kelp. It hides from foes while storing up power for its evolution.
descriptions.dragalge: Tales are told of ships that wander into seas where Dragalge live, never to return.
descriptions.clauncher: Through controlled explosions of internal gas, it can expel water like a pistol shot. At close distances, it can shatter rock.
descriptions.clawitzer: By expelling water from the nozzle in the back of its claw, it can move at a speed of 60 knots.
descriptions.helioptile: The frills on either side of its head have cells that generate electricity when exposed to sunlight.
descriptions.heliolisk: It stimulates its muscles with electricity, boosting the strength in its legs and enabling it to run 100 yards in five seconds.
descriptions.tyrunt: Its immense jaws have enough destructive force that it can chew up an automobile. It lived 100 million years ago.
descriptions.tyrantrum: Nothing could stop this Pokémon 100 million years ago, so it behaved like a king.
descriptions.amaura: This calm Pokémon lived in a cold land where there were no violent predators like Tyrantrum.
descriptions.aurorus: Using its diamond-shaped crystals, it can instantly create a wall of ice to block an opponent's attack.
descriptions.sylveon: It wraps its ribbonlike feelers around the arm of its beloved Trainer and walks with him or her.
descriptions.hawlucha: With its wings, it controls its position in the air. It likes to attack from above, a maneuver that is difficult to defend against.
descriptions.dedenne: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.
descriptions.carbink: It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. It's occasionally found during the excavation of caves.
descriptions.goomy: It's covered in a slimy membrane that makes any punches or kicks slide off it harmlessly.
descriptions.sliggoo: Its four horns are a high-performance radar system. It uses them to sense sounds and smells, rather than using ears or a nose.
descriptions.sliggoo-hisui: A creature given to melancholy. I suspect its metallic shell developed as a result of the mucus on its skin reacting with the iron in Hisui's water.
descriptions.goodra: It attacks with retractable horns. It throws a punch that's the equivalent of the force of a hundred pro boxers.
descriptions.goodra-hisui: Able to freely control the hardness of its metallic shell. It loathes solitude and is extremely clingy—it will fume and run riot if those dearest to it ever leave its side.
descriptions.klefki: It never lets go of a key that it likes, so people give it the keys to vaults and safes as a way to prevent crime.
descriptions.phantump: According to old tales, these Pokémon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died while lost in the forest.
descriptions.trevenant: Using its roots as a nervous system, it controls the trees in the forest. It's kind to the Pokémon that reside in its body.
descriptions.pumpkaboo: It is said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on.
descriptions.pumpkaboo-small: When taking spirits to the afterlife, small Pumpkaboo prefer the spirits of children to those of adults.
descriptions.pumpkaboo-large: When taking spirits to the afterlife, large Pumpkaboo prefer the spirits of adults to those of children.
descriptions.pumpkaboo-super: Supersized Pumpkaboo are very partial to the spirits of people who were of similarly superior proportions.
descriptions.gourgeist: It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms. It sings joyfully as it observes the suffering of its prey.
descriptions.gourgeist-small: Small Gourgeist pretend to be children to fool adults. Anyone who falls for the act gets carried away to the hereafter.
descriptions.gourgeist-large: Large Gourgeist put on the guise of adults, taking the hands of children to lead them to the afterlife.
descriptions.gourgeist-super: Supersized Gourgeist aren't picky. They will forcefully drag anyone off to the afterlife.
descriptions.bergmite: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.
descriptions.avalugg: The way several Bergmite huddle on its back makes it look like an aircraft carrier made of ice.
descriptions.avalugg-hisui: The armor of ice covering its lower jaw puts steel to shame and can shatter rocks with ease. This Pokémon barrels along steep mountain paths, cleaving through the deep snow.
descriptions.noibat: Even a robust wrestler will become dizzy and unable to stand when exposed to its 200,000-hertz ultrasonic waves.
descriptions.noivern: The ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears can reduce a large boulder to pebbles. It swoops out of the dark to attack.
descriptions.xerneas: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.
descriptions.xerneas-active: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.
descriptions.yveltal: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.
descriptions.zygarde: It's hypothesized that it's monitoring those who destroy the ecosystem from deep in the cave where it lives.
descriptions.zygarde-10: Born when around 10% of Zygarde's cells have been gathered from all over, this form is skilled in close-range combat.
descriptions.zygarde-10c: Born when around 10% of Zygarde's cells have been gathered from all over, this form is skilled in close-range combat.
descriptions.zygarde-50c: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.
descriptions.zygarde-complete: Born when all of Zygarde's cells have been gathered together, it uses force to neutralize those who harm the ecosystem.
descriptions.diancie: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.
descriptions.hoopa: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.
descriptions.hoopa-unbound: In its true form, it possesses a huge amount of power. Legends of its avarice tell how it once carried off an entire castle to gain the treasure hidden within.
descriptions.volcanion: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.
descriptions.rowlet: It feels relaxed in tight, dark places and has been known to use its Trainer's pocket or bag as a nest.
descriptions.dartrix: Supremely sensitive to the presence of others, it can detect opponents standing behind it, flinging its sharp feathers to take them out.
descriptions.decidueye: Decidueye can nock and fire an arrow at an enemy in a tenth of a second, so its battles are decided in the blink of an eye.
descriptions.decidueye-hisui: The air stored inside the rachises of Decidueye's feathers insulates the Pokémon against Hisui's extreme cold. This is firm proof that evolution can be influenced by environment.
descriptions.litten: Its coat regrows twice a year. When the time comes, Litten sets its own body on fire and burns away the old fur.
descriptions.torracat: When its mane is standing on end, you can tell it's feeling good. When it isn't feeling well, its fur will lie down flat.
descriptions.incineroar: When its fighting spirit is set alight, the flames around its waist become especially intense.
descriptions.popplio: Popplio gets on top of its bouncy water balloons to jump higher. It's quite the acrobatic fighter!
descriptions.brionne: It attacks by smacking its enemies with the exploding water balloons that it creates.
descriptions.primarina: Also known as a songstress, it has a fantastical look on moonlit nights when it leads its colony in song.
descriptions.pikipek: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!
descriptions.trumbeak: From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise to new plants.
descriptions.toucannon: Known for forming harmonious couples, this Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a good luck charm.
descriptions.yungoos: Although it will eat anything, it prefers fresh living things, so it marches down streets in search of prey.
descriptions.gumshoos: Patient by nature, this Pokémon loses control of itself and pounces when it spots its favorite meal—Rattata!
descriptions.grubbin: It spits a sticky thread to stop opponents in their tracks, and then it grabs them in its sharp, sturdy mandibles to take them down.
descriptions.charjabug: Its stout shell provides excellent defense from attacks. It uses electricity on persistent opponents.
descriptions.vikavolt: Vikavolt flusters opponents with acrobatic flying maneuvers. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electric beam attack.
descriptions.crabrawler: Crabrawler has been known to mistake Exeggutor for a coconut tree and climb it. The enraged Exeggutor shakes it off and stomps it.
descriptions.crabominable: Before it stops to think, it just starts pummeling. There are records of its turning back avalanches with a flurry of punches.
descriptions.oricorio: This Oricorio has drunk red nectar. If its Trainer gives the wrong order, this passionate Pokémon becomes fiercely angry.
descriptions.oricorio-pompom: This Oricorio has drunk bright yellow nectar. When it sees someone looking glum, it will try to cheer them up with a dance.
descriptions.oricorio-pau: This Oricorio has sipped pink nectar. It gets so caught up in its dancing that it sometimes doesn't hear its Trainer's orders.
descriptions.oricorio-sensu: This Oricorio has sipped purple nectar. Some dancers use its graceful, elegant dancing as inspiration.
descriptions.cutiefly: Cutiefly can pick up the auras of living things. It skillfully reads those auras to predict its foes' movements and make fools of them.
descriptions.ribombee: It can predict the weather from moisture levels and wind direction. Ribombee only reveals itself when there are a few clear days in a row.
