descriptions.rockruff: When it rubs the rocks on its neck against you, that's proof of its love for you. However, the rocks are sharp, so the gesture is quite painful!
descriptions.rockruff-dusk: This Pokémon can bond very strongly with its Trainer, but it also has a habit of biting. Raising a Rockruff for a long time can be challenging.
descriptions.lycanroc: The rocks in its mane are sharper than a knife. Fragments that break off are treasured as good luck charms.
descriptions.lycanroc-midnight: They live alone without forming packs. They will only listen to orders from Trainers who can draw out their true power.
descriptions.lycanroc-dusk: Bathed in the setting sun of evening, Lycanroc has undergone a special kind of evolution. An intense fighting spirit underlies its calmness.
descriptions.wishiwashi: When it's in a jam, its shining eyes attract others of its kind. The light from its eyes is visible almost 25 miles away.
descriptions.wishiwashi-school: Called "demon of the sea" by some, when Wishiwashi are injured in battle and their numbers dwindle, they become a regular school.
descriptions.mareanie: Aside from its head, its body parts regenerate quickly if they're cut off. After a good night's sleep, Mareanie is back to normal.
descriptions.toxapex: With its 12 legs, it creates a dome to shelter within. The flow of the tides doesn't affect Toxapex in there, so it's very comfortable.
descriptions.mudbray: Possessing mighty power, Mudbray can be loaded with 50 times its own body weight and will be totally fine.
descriptions.mudsdale: It can trudge mountain roads without rest for three days and three nights, all the while dragging a 10-ton load.
descriptions.dewpider: It can only breathe oxygen that has dissolved in water, so it wears a water bubble on its head when it walks around on land.
descriptions.araquanid: It has a habit of storing things it values in its water bubble. If its Trainer doesn't watch out, Araquanid will try to put them in its bubble!
descriptions.fomantis: It loves the sunshine. When it basks in the sunlight regularly, it grows up with vivid coloration.
descriptions.lurantis: As it slashes into its enemies, it looks like it's dancing. Its elegant appearance has led some to call it the most glamorous Grass Pokémon.
descriptions.morelull: It likes damp dark places. When night falls, the spores filling the caps of its mushrooms glow.
descriptions.shiinotic: When it starts fighting for territory with Parasect, the entire area gets completely coated in spores!
descriptions.salandit: It weakens opponents and sends them reeling with its poisonous gas. Salandit doesn't deal well with Spinda, since it's always reeling.
descriptions.salazzle: It punishes Salandit that couldn't bring it food with a fierce slap of its flame-spewing palm.
descriptions.stufful: Stufful hates to be hugged or touched in any way. It will squirm, thrash, and resist with amazing power.
descriptions.bewear: It waves its hands wildly in intimidation and warning. Life is over for anyone who doesn't run away as fast as possible.
descriptions.bounsweet: It tries to resist being swallowed by a bird Pokémon by spinning the sepals on its head. It's usually a fruitless attempt.
descriptions.steenee: It bounces around, swinging the sepals on its head with abandon. They're quite painful when they smack you!
descriptions.tsareena: A Pokémon with an aggressive personality and a mastery of kicking, it cackles every time it kicks an opponent.
descriptions.comfey: It picks flowers and sticks them to its body with fluids it produces. The aroma that wafts from its petals has a healing effect.
descriptions.oranguru: Oranguru don't get along with each other, so they're always engaging in battles of wits to decide which one is superior.
descriptions.passimian: Berries are its weapons as well as the staple of its diet. The one that can throw a berry the farthest is the boss of the troop.
descriptions.wimpod: An astonishingly cowardly Pokémon, Wimpod will whir its legs at high speeds to run away if anything comes near it.
descriptions.golisopod: Its claws, which it can extend and retract at will, are its greatest weapons. Golisopod is sometimes accompanied by Wimpod.
descriptions.sandygast: If you build sand mounds when you're playing, destroy them before you go home, or they may get possessed and become Sandygast.
descriptions.palossand: Once it has whipped up a sandstorm to halt its opponents in their tracks, this terrifying Pokémon snatches away their vitality.
descriptions.pyukumuku: Its entire body is covered in its own slime. If you accidentally step on one, you'll slip, and it will get mad and smack you!
descriptions.typenull: There's danger of its going on a rampage, so its true power is sealed away beneath its control mask.
descriptions.silvally: Through the bond it formed with its Trainer, its will was strengthened, and it was able to destroy its control mask.
descriptions.silvally-fighting: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-flying: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-poison: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-ground: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-rock: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-bug: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-ghost: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-steel: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-fire: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-water: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-grass: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-electric: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-psychic: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-ice: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-dragon: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-dark: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.silvally-fairy: Its capacity to change types unleashed, it shines silver due to the energy springing forth from within.
descriptions.minior: This is its form when its shell has fallen off. The color of its core depends on the materials that made up the food it ate.
descriptions.minior-meteor: This Pokémon is born in the ozone layer. It falls to the ground once the outer shell enclosing its core grows heavy.
descriptions.minior-orange: This is its form when its shell has fallen off. The color of its core depends on the materials that made up the food it ate.
descriptions.minior-yellow: This is its form when its shell has fallen off. The color of its core depends on the materials that made up the food it ate.
descriptions.minior-green: This is its form when its shell has fallen off. The color of its core depends on the materials that made up the food it ate.
descriptions.minior-blue: This is its form when its shell has fallen off. The color of its core depends on the materials that made up the food it ate.
descriptions.minior-indigo: This is its form when its shell has fallen off. The color of its core depends on the materials that made up the food it ate.
descriptions.minior-violet: This is its form when its shell has fallen off. The color of its core depends on the materials that made up the food it ate.
descriptions.komala: It remains asleep from birth to death as a result of the sedative properties of the leaves that form its diet.
descriptions.turtonator: Its exploding shell poses a real danger but is sensitive to moisture. On rainy days, Turtonator takes silent refuge in caves.
descriptions.togedemaru: Its capacity to produce electricity is somewhat limited, so it gets charged up by letting lightning strike it!
descriptions.mimikyu: A gust of wind revealed what hides under this Pokémon's rag to a passing Trainer, who went home and died painfully that very night.
descriptions.mimikyu-busted: Sad that its true identity may be exposed, Mimikyu will mercilessly seek revenge on any opponent that breaks its neck.
descriptions.bruxish: Its skin is thick enough to fend off Mareanie's spikes. With its robust teeth, Bruxish crunches up the spikes and eats them.
descriptions.drampa: It appears in towns and plays with the children. Drampa will protect kids when they're in danger, so their moms don't have to worry.
descriptions.dhelmise: Its chain-like green seaweed can stretch outward for hundreds of yards. For some reason, it gets along well with Skrelp.
descriptions.jangmoo: It will never show an enemy its back in battle. Ancient warriors liked Jangmo-o for its valiant disposition and made it one of their own.
descriptions.hakamoo: The scales it sheds can be molded and processed to make pots and pans. They conduct heat well, so they're a popular item.
descriptions.kommoo: It battles valiantly with its fists, which are armored in steel scales. Kommo-o specializes in uppercuts.
descriptions.tapukoko: The lightning-wielding guardian deity of Melemele, Tapu Koko is brimming with curiosity and appears before people from time to time.
descriptions.tapulele: Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and can be described as nature incarnate.
descriptions.tapubulu: It makes ringing sounds with its tail to let others know where it is, avoiding unneeded conflicts. This guardian deity of Ula'ula controls plants.
descriptions.tapufini: Although it's called a guardian deity, terrible calamities sometimes befall those who recklessly approach Tapu Fini.
descriptions.cosmog: Whether or not it's a Pokémon from this world is a mystery. When it's in a jam, it warps away to a safe place to hide.
descriptions.cosmoem: As it absorbs light, Cosmoem continues to grow. Its golden shell is surprisingly solid.
descriptions.solgaleo: In writings from the distant past, it's called by the name "the beast that devours the sun."
descriptions.lunala: It sometimes summons unknown powers and life-forms here to this world from holes that lead to other worlds.
descriptions.nihilego: A life-form from another world, it was dubbed a UB and is thought to produce a strong neurotoxin.
descriptions.buzzwole: Buzzwole goes around showing off its abnormally swollen muscles. It is one kind of Ultra Beast.
descriptions.pheromosa: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
descriptions.xurkitree: They've been dubbed Ultra Beasts. Some of them stand unmoving, like trees, with their arms and legs stuck into the ground.
descriptions.celesteela: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
descriptions.kartana: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
descriptions.guzzlord: An unknown life-form called a UB. It may be constantly hungry—it is certainly always devouring something.
descriptions.necrozma: Light is the source of its energy. If it isn't devouring light, impurities build up in it and on it, and Necrozma darkens and stops moving.
descriptions.necrozma-duskmane: This is Necrozma's form while it's absorbing the power of Solgaleo, making it extremely ferocious and impossible to control.
descriptions.necrozma-dawnwings: This is its form while it's devouring the light of Lunala. It grasps foes in its giant claws and rips them apart with brute force.
descriptions.necrozma-ultra: The light pouring out from all over its body affects living things and nature, impacting them in various ways.
descriptions.magearna: Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist, the part called the Soul-Heart is the actual life-form.
descriptions.magearna-original: It functions thanks to its artificial soul. The vivid decoration is proof that it was presented as a gift to royalty.
descriptions.marshadow: It sinks into the shadows of people and Pokémon, where it can understand their feelings and copy their capabilities.
descriptions.poipole: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.
descriptions.naganadel: It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid inside its body. It is one of the organisms known as UBs.
descriptions.stakataka: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the brute's true identity was this mysterious life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.
descriptions.blacephalon: It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It's apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.
descriptions.zeraora: It approaches its enemies at the speed of lightning, then tears them limb from limb with its sharp claws.
descriptions.meltan: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.
descriptions.melmetal: Revered long ago for its capacity to create iron from nothing, for some reason it has come back to life after 3,000 years.
descriptions.melmetal-gmax: In a distant land, there are legends about a cyclopean giant. In fact, the giant was a Melmetal that was flooded with Gigantamax energy.
descriptions.grookey: When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.
descriptions.thwackey: The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.
descriptions.rillaboom: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.
descriptions.rillaboom-gmax: Gigantamax energy has caused Rillaboom's stump to grow into a drum set that resembles a forest.
descriptions.scorbunny: A warm-up of running around gets fire energy coursing through this Pokémon's body. Once that happens, it's ready to fight at full power.
descriptions.raboot: Its thick and fluffy fur protects it from the cold and enables it to use hotter fire moves.
descriptions.cinderace: It juggles a pebble with its feet, turning it into a burning soccer ball. Its shots strike opponents hard and leave them scorched.
descriptions.cinderace-gmax: Infused with Cinderace's fighting spirit, the gigantic Pyro Ball never misses its targets and completely roasts opponents.
descriptions.sobble: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won't be able to resist weeping.
descriptions.drizzile: A clever combatant, this Pokémon battles using water balloons created with moisture secreted from its palms.
descriptions.inteleon: It has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips that can shoot water and a membrane on its back that it can use to glide through the air.
descriptions.inteleon-gmax: Gigantamax Inteleon's Water Gun move fires at Mach 7. As the Pokémon takes aim, it uses the crest on its head to gauge wind and temperature.
descriptions.skwovet: It stores berries in its cheeks. When there are no berries to be found, Skwovet will stuff pebbles into its cheeks to stave off its cravings.
descriptions.greedent: It stashes berries in its tail—so many berries that they fall out constantly. But this Pokémon is a bit slow-witted, so it doesn't notice the loss.
descriptions.rookidee: It will bravely challenge any opponent, no matter how powerful. This Pokémon benefits from every battle—even a defeat increases its strength a bit.
descriptions.corvisquire: Smart enough to use tools in battle, these Pokémon have been seen picking up rocks and flinging them or using ropes to wrap up enemies.
descriptions.corviknight: Although its wings have partly turned to steel and become heavy as a result, this Pokémon flies through the skies with ease.
descriptions.corviknight-gmax: Imbued with Gigantamax energy, its wings can whip up winds more forceful than any a hurricane could muster. The gusts blow everything away.
descriptions.blipbug: A constant collector of information, this Pokémon is very smart. Very strong is what it isn't.
descriptions.dottler: It barely moves, but it's still alive. Hiding in its shell without food or water seems to have awakened its psychic powers.
descriptions.orbeetle: It's famous for its high level of intelligence, and the large size of its brain is proof that it also possesses immense psychic power.
descriptions.orbeetle-gmax: Its brain has grown to a gargantuan size, as has the rest of its body. This Pokémon's intellect and psychic abilities are overpowering.
descriptions.nickit: Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.
descriptions.thievul: It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.
descriptions.gossifleur: It anchors itself in the ground with its single leg, then basks in the sun. After absorbing enough sunlight, its petals spread as it blooms brilliantly.
descriptions.eldegoss: The seeds attached to its cotton fluff are full of nutrients. It spreads them on the wind so that plants and other Pokémon can benefit from them.
descriptions.wooloo: Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.
descriptions.dubwool: Weave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end up with something closer to a trampoline. You'll start to bounce the moment you set foot on it.
descriptions.chewtle: Apparently the itch of its teething impels it to snap its jaws at anything in front of it.
descriptions.drednaw: With jaws that can shear through steel rods, this highly aggressive Pokémon chomps down on its unfortunate prey.
descriptions.drednaw-gmax: It responded to Gigantamax energy by becoming bipedal. First it comes crashing down on foes, and then it finishes them off with its massive jaws.
descriptions.yamper: This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.
descriptions.boltund: This Pokémon generates electricity and channels it into its legs to keep them going strong. Boltund can run nonstop for three full days.
descriptions.rolycoly: Most of its body has the same composition as coal. Fittingly, this Pokémon was first discovered in coal mines about 400 years ago.
descriptions.carkol: The temperature inside its body increases when it experiences strong emotions. It rolls around frantically while spewing flames.
descriptions.coalossal: It's usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines enrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with flames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.
descriptions.coalossal-gmax: Its body is a colossal stove. With Gigantamax energy stoking the fire, this Pokémon's flame burns hotter than 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
descriptions.applin: It spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides from its natural enemies, bird Pokémon, by pretending it's just an apple and nothing more.
descriptions.flapple: It ate a sour apple, and that induced its evolution. In its cheeks, it stores an acid capable of causing chemical burns.
descriptions.flapple-gmax: Under the influence of Gigantamax energy, it produces much more sweet nectar, and its shape has changed to resemble a giant apple.
descriptions.appletun: Eating a sweet apple caused its evolution. A nectarous scent wafts from its body, luring in the bug Pokémon it preys on.
descriptions.appletun-gmax: It blasts its opponents with massive amounts of sweet, sticky nectar, drowning them under the deluge.
descriptions.silicobra: As it digs, it swallows sand and stores it in its neck pouch. The pouch can hold more than 17 pounds of sand.
descriptions.sandaconda: When it contracts its body, over 220 pounds of sand sprays from its nose. If it ever runs out of sand, it becomes disheartened.
descriptions.sandaconda-gmax: Its sand pouch has grown to tremendous proportions. More than 1,000,000 tons of sand now swirl around its body.
descriptions.cramorant: It's so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it's battling midfight.
descriptions.cramorant-gulping: Cramorant's gluttony led it to try to swallow an Arrokuda whole, which in turn led to Cramorant getting an Arrokuda stuck in its throat.
descriptions.cramorant-gorging: This Cramorant has accidentally gotten a Pikachu lodged in its gullet. Cramorant is choking a little, but it isn't really bothered.
descriptions.arrokuda: If it sees any movement around it, this Pokémon charges for it straightaway, leading with its sharply pointed jaw. It's very proud of that jaw.
descriptions.barraskewda: This Pokémon has a jaw that's as sharp as a spear and as strong as steel. Apparently Barraskewda's flesh is surprisingly tasty, too.
descriptions.toxel: It stores poison in an internal poison sac and secretes that poison through its skin. If you touch this Pokémon, a tingling sensation follows.
descriptions.toxtricity: When this Pokémon sounds as if it's strumming a guitar, it's actually clawing at the protrusions on its chest to generate electricity.
descriptions.toxtricity-lowkey: Capable of generating 15,000 volts of electricity, this Pokémon looks down on all that would challenge it.
descriptions.toxtricity-gmax: Its excessive electric energy is its weapon. This Pokémon can build up more electricity than any thundercloud.
descriptions.sizzlipede: It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.
descriptions.centiskorch: When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.
descriptions.centiskorch-gmax: Gigantamax energy has evoked a rise in its body temperature, now reaching over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. Its heat waves incinerate its enemies.
descriptions.clobbopus: It's very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.
descriptions.grapploct: A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.
descriptions.sinistea: This Pokémon is said to have been born when a lonely spirit possessed a cold, leftover cup of tea.
descriptions.sinistea-antique: The swirl pattern in this Pokémon's body is its weakness. If it gets stirred, the swirl loses its shape, and Sinistea gets dizzy.
descriptions.polteageist: This species lives in antique teapots. Most pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions, an authentic work is found.
descriptions.polteageist-antique: Trainers Polteageist trusts will be allowed to experience its distinctive flavor and aroma firsthand by sampling just a tiny bit of its tea.
descriptions.hatenna: Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures' emotions. If you don't have a calm disposition, it will never warm up to you.
descriptions.hattrem: No matter who you are, if you bring strong emotions near this Pokémon, it will silence you violently.
descriptions.hatterene: It emits psychic power strong enough to cause headaches as a deterrent to the approach of others.
descriptions.hatterene-gmax: This Pokémon can read the emotions of creatures over 30 miles away. The minute it senses hostility, it goes on the attack.
descriptions.impidimp: Through its nose, it sucks in the emanations produced by people and Pokémon when they feel annoyed. It thrives off this negative energy.
descriptions.morgrem: When it gets down on all fours as if to beg for forgiveness, it's trying to lure opponents in so that it can stab them with its spear-like hair.
descriptions.grimmsnarl: With the hair wrapped around its body helping to enhance its muscles, this Pokémon can overwhelm even Machamp.
descriptions.grimmsnarl-gmax: By transforming its leg hair, this Pokémon delivers power-packed drill kicks that can bore huge holes in Galar's terrain.
descriptions.obstagoon: Its voice is staggering in volume. Obstagoon has a tendency to take on a threatening posture and shout—this move is known as Obstruct.
descriptions.perrserker: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.
descriptions.cursola: Its shell is overflowing with its heightened otherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as protection for this Pokémon's core spirit.
descriptions.sirfetchd: Only Farfetch'd that have survived many battles can attain this evolution. When this Pokémon's leek withers, it will retire from combat.
descriptions.mrrime: It's highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane of ice in time with its graceful movements.
descriptions.runerigus: A powerful curse was woven into an ancient painting. After absorbing the spirit of a Yamask, the painting began to move.
descriptions.milcery: This Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.
descriptions.alcremie: When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to berries it's decorated with cream.
descriptions.alcremie-rubycream: The moment it evolved, it took on a sweet and tart flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
descriptions.alcremie-matchacream: The moment it evolved, it took on an aromatic flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
descriptions.alcremie-mintcream: The moment it evolved, it took on a refreshing flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
descriptions.alcremie-lemoncream: The moment it evolved, it took on a sour flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
descriptions.alcremie-saltedcream: The moment it evolved, it took on a salty flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
descriptions.alcremie-rubyswirl: The moment it evolved, it took on a mixed flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
descriptions.alcremie-caramelswirl: The moment it evolved, it took on a bitter flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
descriptions.alcremie-rainbowswirl: The moment it evolved, it took on a complex flavor. This is because of the way its cells spontaneously shifted during evolution.
descriptions.alcremie-gmax: Cream pours endlessly from this Pokémon's body. The cream stiffens when compressed by an impact. A harder impact results in harder cream.
descriptions.falinks: Five of them are troopers, and one is the brass. The brass's orders are absolute.
descriptions.pincurchin: It feeds on seaweed, using its teeth to scrape it off rocks. Electric current flows from the tips of its spines.
descriptions.snom: It spits out thread imbued with a frigid sort of energy and uses it to tie its body to branches, disguising itself as an icicle while it sleeps.
descriptions.frosmoth: Icy scales fall from its wings like snow as it flies over fields and mountains. The temperature of its wings is less than −290 degrees Fahrenheit.
descriptions.stonjourner: It stands in grasslands, watching the sun's descent from zenith to horizon. This Pokémon has a talent for delivering dynamic kicks.
descriptions.eiscue: It drifted in on the flow of ocean waters from a frigid place. It keeps its head iced constantly to make sure it stays nice and cold.
descriptions.eiscue-noiceface: The ice covering this Pokémon's face has shattered, revealing a slightly worried expression that many people are enamored with.
descriptions.indeedee: It uses the horns on its head to sense the emotions of others. Males will act as valets for those they serve, looking after their every need.
descriptions.indeedee-f: These intelligent Pokémon touch horns with each other to share information between them.
descriptions.morpeko: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It's also generating electricity.
descriptions.morpeko-hangry: Intense hunger drives it to extremes of violence, and the electricity in its cheek sacs has converted into a Dark-type energy.
descriptions.cufant: It digs up the ground with its trunk. It's also very strong, being able to carry loads of over five tons without any problem at all.
descriptions.copperajah: They came over from another region long ago and worked together with humans. Their green skin is resistant to water.
descriptions.copperajah-gmax: So much power is packed within its trunk that if it were to unleash that power, the resulting blast could level mountains and change the landscape.
descriptions.dracozolt: In ancient times, it was unbeatable thanks to its powerful lower body, but it went extinct anyway after it depleted all its plant-based food sources.
descriptions.arctozolt: The shaking of its freezing upper half is what generates its electricity. It has a hard time walking around.
descriptions.dracovish: Powerful legs and jaws made it the apex predator of its time. Its own overhunting of its prey was what drove it to extinction.
descriptions.arctovish: Though it's able to capture prey by freezing its surroundings, it has trouble eating the prey afterward because its mouth is on top of its head.
descriptions.duraludon: Its body resembles polished metal, and it's both lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that it rusts easily.
descriptions.duraludon-gmax: It's grown to resemble a skyscraper. Parts of its towering body glow due to a profusion of energy.
descriptions.dreepy: After being reborn as a ghost Pokémon, Dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.
descriptions.drakloak: It's capable of flying faster than 120 mph. It battles alongside Dreepy and dotes on them until they successfully evolve.
descriptions.dragapult: When it isn't battling, it keeps Dreepy in the holes on its horns. Once a fight starts, it launches the Dreepy like supersonic missiles.
descriptions.zacian: Known as a legendary hero, this Pokémon absorbs metal particles, transforming them into a weapon it uses to battle.
descriptions.zacian-crowned: Now armed with a weapon it used in ancient times, this Pokémon needs only a single strike to fell even Gigantamax Pokémon.
descriptions.zamazenta: In times past, it worked together with a king of the people to save the Galar region. It absorbs metal that it then uses in battle.
descriptions.zamazenta-crowned: Its ability to deflect any attack led to it being known as the Fighting Master's Shield. It was feared and respected by all.
descriptions.eternatus: The core on its chest absorbs energy emanating from the lands of the Galar region. This energy is what allows Eternatus to stay active.
descriptions.eternatus-eternamax: As a result of Rose's meddling, Eternatus absorbed all the energy in the Galar region. It's now in a state of power overload.
descriptions.kubfu: Kubfu trains hard to perfect its moves. The moves it masters will determine which form it takes when it evolves.
descriptions.urshifu: This form of Urshifu is a strong believer in the one-hit KO. Its strategy is to leap in close to foes and land a devastating blow with a hardened fist.
descriptions.urshifu-rapidstrike: It's believed that this Pokémon modeled its fighting style on the flow of a river—sometimes rapid, sometimes calm.
descriptions.urshifu-gmax: People call it the embodiment of rage. It's said that this Pokémon's terrifying expression and shout will rid the world of malevolence.
descriptions.urshifu-rapidstrikegmax: As it waits for the right moment to unleash its Gigantamax power, this Pokémon maintains a perfect one-legged stance. It won't even twitch.
descriptions.zarude: Within dense forests, this Pokémon lives in a pack with others of its kind. It's incredibly aggressive, and the other Pokémon of the forest fear it.
descriptions.zarude-dada: This Zarude left its pack to raise a human child. The cloth Zarude would wrap the child with has a comforting scent that calmed the child's crying.
descriptions.regieleki: This Pokémon is a cluster of electrical energy. It's said that removing the rings on Regieleki's body will unleash the Pokémon's latent power.
descriptions.regidrago: An academic theory proposes that Regidrago's arms were once the head of an ancient dragon Pokémon. The theory remains unproven.
descriptions.glastrier: Glastrier emits intense cold from its hooves. It's also a belligerent Pokémon—anything it wants, it takes by force.
descriptions.spectrier: It probes its surroundings with all its senses save one—it doesn't use its sense of sight. Spectrier's kicks are said to separate soul from body.
descriptions.calyrex: Calyrex is a merciful Pokémon, capable of providing healing and blessings. It reigned over the Galar region in times of yore.
descriptions.calyrex-ice: According to lore, this Pokémon showed no mercy to those who got in its way, yet it would heal its opponents' wounds after battle.
descriptions.calyrex-shadow: It's said that Calyrex and a Pokémon that had bonded with it ran all across the Galar region to bring green to the wastelands.
descriptions.wyrdeer: The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the Pokémon is erecting invisible barriers. The fur shed from its beard retains heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.
descriptions.kleavor: Parts of its body turned to stone when it evolved thanks to an extremely rare ore found in volcanic areas.
descriptions.ursaluna: I believe it was Hisui's swampy terrain that gave Ursaluna its burly physique and newfound capacity to manipulate peat at will.
descriptions.ursaluna-bloodmoon: It crossed the sea and drifted ashore in a new land. Surviving in this place led it to take on a unique appearance and gain special powers.
descriptions.basculegion: This Pokémon is cloaked in the souls of its comrades who perished during a punishing journey to the river of their birth.
descriptions.basculegion-f: The souls of its comrades cloak its body and propel it effortlessly through even raging rapids.
descriptions.sneasler: Because of Sneasler's virulent poison and daunting physical prowess, no other species could hope to best it on the frozen highlands. Preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.
descriptions.overqwil: Overqwil's poisonous spikes will reflexively react even while Overqwil sleeps, stabbing any moving thing that approaches.
descriptions.enamorus: When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémon's love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.
descriptions.enamorus-therian: A different guise from its feminine humanoid form. From the clouds, it descends upon those who treat any form of life with disrespect and metes out wrathful, ruthless punishment.
descriptions.sprigatito: Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. This Pokémon frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.
descriptions.floragato: Floragato deftly wields the vine hidden beneath its long fur, slamming the hard flower bud against its opponents.
descriptions.meowscarada: This Pokémon uses the reflective fur lining its cape to camouflage the stem of its flower, creating the illusion that the flower is floating.
descriptions.fuecoco: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.
descriptions.crocalor: The combination of Crocalor's fire energy and overflowing vitality has caused an egg-shaped fireball to appear on the Pokémon's head.
descriptions.skeledirge: The fiery bird changes shape when Skeledirge sings. Rumor has it that the bird was born when the fireball on Skeledirge's head gained a soul.
descriptions.quaxly: Its strong legs let it easily swim around in even fast-flowing rivers. It likes to keep things tidy and is prone to overthinking things.
descriptions.quaxwell: These Pokémon constantly run through shallow waters to train their legs, then compete with each other to see which of them kicks most gracefully.
descriptions.quaquaval: A single kick from a Quaquaval can send a truck rolling. This Pokémon uses its powerful legs to perform striking dances from far-off lands.
descriptions.lechonk: It searches for food all day. It possesses a keen sense of smell but doesn't use it for anything other than foraging.
descriptions.oinkologne: Oinkologne is proud of its fine, glossy skin. It emits a concentrated scent from the tip of its tail.
descriptions.oinkologne-f: This Pokémon sends a flowerlike scent wafting about. Well-developed muscles in its legs allow it to leap more than 16 feet with no trouble at all.
descriptions.tarountula: The ball of threads wrapped around its body is elastic enough to deflect the scythes of Scyther, this Pokémon's natural enemy.
descriptions.spidops: It clings to branches and ceilings using its threads and moves without a sound. It takes out its prey before the prey even notices it.
descriptions.nymble: It has its third set of legs folded up. When it's in a tough spot, this Pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.
descriptions.lokix: When it decides to fight all out, it stands on its previously folded legs to enter Showdown Mode. It neutralizes its enemies in short order.
descriptions.pawmi: It has underdeveloped electric sacs on its cheeks. These sacs can produce electricity only if Pawmi rubs them furiously with the pads on its forepaws.
descriptions.pawmo: When its group is attacked, Pawmo is the first to leap into battle, defeating enemies with a fighting technique that utilizes electric shocks.
descriptions.pawmot: This Pokémon normally is slow to react, but once it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies with lightning-fast movements.
descriptions.tandemaus: Exhibiting great teamwork, they use their incisors to cut pieces out of any material that might be useful for a nest, then make off with them.
descriptions.maushold: They build huge nests with many rooms that are used for different purposes, such as eating and sleeping.
descriptions.maushold-four: The two little ones just appeared one day. The group might be a family of related Pokémon, but nobody knows for sure.
descriptions.fidough: This Pokémon is smooth and moist to the touch. Yeast in Fidough's breath induces fermentation in the Pokémon's vicinity.
descriptions.dachsbun: The pleasant aroma that emanates from this Pokémon's body helps wheat grow, so Dachsbun has been treasured by farming villages.
descriptions.smoliv: It protects itself from enemies by emitting oil from the fruit on its head. This oil is bitter and astringent enough to make someone flinch.
descriptions.dolliv: Dolliv shares its tasty, fresh-scented oil with others. This species has coexisted with humans since times long gone.
descriptions.arboliva: This calm Pokémon is very compassionate. It will share its delicious, nutrient-rich oil with weakened Pokémon.
descriptions.squawkabilly: These Pokémon prefer to live in cities. They form flocks based on the color of their feathers, and they fight over territory.
descriptions.squawkabilly-blue: The largest of their flocks can contain more than 50 individuals. They fly around towns and forests, searching for food and making a racket.
descriptions.squawkabilly-yellow: These Squawkabilly are hotheaded, and their fighting style is vicious. They'll leap within reach of their foes to engage in close combat.
descriptions.squawkabilly-white: This Pokémon dislikes being alone. It has a strong sense of community and survives by cooperating with allies.
descriptions.nacli: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.
descriptions.naclstack: This Pokémon dry cures its prey by spraying salt over them. The curing process steals away the water in the prey's body.
descriptions.garganacl: Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured Pokémon with salt. Even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.
descriptions.charcadet: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.
descriptions.armarouge: Armarouge evolved through the use of a set of armor that belonged to a distinguished warrior. This Pokémon is incredibly loyal.
descriptions.ceruledge: The fiery blades on its arms burn fiercely with the lingering resentment of a sword wielder who fell before accomplishing their goal.
descriptions.tadbulb: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.
descriptions.bellibolt: When this Pokémon expands and contracts its wobbly body, the belly-button dynamo in its stomach produces a huge amount of electricity.
descriptions.wattrel: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokémon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.
descriptions.kilowattrel: Kilowattrel inflates its throat sac to amplify its electricity. By riding the wind, this Pokémon can fly over 430 miles in a day.
descriptions.maschiff: It always scowls in an attempt to make opponents take it seriously, but even crying children will burst into laughter when they see Maschiff's face.
descriptions.mabosstiff: This Pokémon can store energy in its large dewlap. Mabosstiff unleashes this energy all at once to blow away enemies.
descriptions.shroodle: Though usually a mellow Pokémon, it will sink its sharp, poison-soaked front teeth into any that anger it, causing paralysis in the object of its ire.
descriptions.grafaiai: The color of the poisonous saliva depends on what the Pokémon eats. Grafaiai covers its fingers in its saliva and draws patterns on trees in forests.
descriptions.bramblin: A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a Pokémon.
descriptions.brambleghast: It will open the branches of its head to envelop its prey. Once it absorbs all the life energy it needs, it expels the prey and discards it.
descriptions.toedscool: Toedscool lives in muggy forests. The flaps that fall from its body are chewy and very delicious.
descriptions.toedscruel: These Pokémon gather into groups and form colonies deep within forests. They absolutely hate it when strangers approach.
descriptions.klawf: Klawf hangs upside-down from cliffs, waiting for prey. But Klawf can't remain in this position for long because its blood rushes to its head.
descriptions.capsakid: The more sunlight this Pokémon bathes in, the more spicy chemicals are produced by its body, and thus the spicier its moves become.
descriptions.scovillain: The red head converts spicy chemicals into fire energy and blasts the surrounding area with a super spicy stream of flame.
descriptions.rellor: This Pokémon creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. It treasures its mud ball more than its own life.
descriptions.rabsca: The body that supports the ball barely moves. Therefore, it is thought that the true body of this Pokémon is actually inside the ball.
descriptions.flittle: Flittle's toes levitate about half an inch above the ground because of the psychic power emitted from the frills on the Pokémon's belly.
descriptions.espathra: It immobilizes opponents by bathing them in psychic power from its large eyes. Despite its appearance, it has a vicious temperament.
descriptions.tinkatink: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokémon that eat metal.
descriptions.tinkatuff: This Pokémon will attack groups of Pawniard and Bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.
descriptions.tinkaton: This intelligent Pokémon has a very daring disposition. It knocks rocks into the sky with its hammer, aiming for flying Corviknight.
descriptions.wiglett: This Pokémon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.
descriptions.wugtrio: It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.
descriptions.bombirdier: It gathers things up in an apron made from shed feathers added to the Pokémon's chest feathers, then drops those things from high places for fun.
descriptions.finizen: It likes playing with others of its kind using the water ring on its tail. It uses ultrasonic waves to sense the emotions of other living creatures.
descriptions.palafin: This Pokémon changes its appearance if it hears its allies calling for help. Palafin will never show anybody its moment of transformation.
descriptions.palafin-hero: This Pokémon's ancient genes have awakened. It is now so extraordinarily strong that it can easily lift a cruise ship with one fin.
descriptions.varoom: It is said that this Pokémon was born when an unknown poison Pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.
descriptions.revavroom: It creates a gas out of poison and minerals from rocks. It then detonates the gas in its cylinders— now numbering eight—to generate energy.
descriptions.cyclizar: Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.
descriptions.orthworm: When attacked, this Pokémon will wield the tendrils on its body like fists and pelt the opponent with a storm of punches.
descriptions.glimmet: It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.
descriptions.glimmora: When this Pokémon detects danger, it will open up its crystalline petals and fire beams from its conical body.
descriptions.greavard: It is said that a dog Pokémon that died in the wild without ever interacting with a human was reborn as this Pokémon.
descriptions.houndstone: Houndstone spends most of its time sleeping in graveyards. Among all the dog Pokémon, this one is most loyal to its master.
descriptions.flamigo: This Pokémon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.
descriptions.cetoddle: This species left the ocean and began living on land a very long time ago. It seems to be closely related to Wailmer.
descriptions.cetitan: This Pokémon wanders around snowy, icy areas. It protects its body with powerful muscles and a thick layer of fat under its skin.
descriptions.veluza: When Veluza discards unnecessary flesh, its mind becomes honed and its psychic power increases. The spare flesh has a mild but delicious flavor.
descriptions.dondozo: This Pokémon is a glutton, but it's bad at getting food. It teams up with a Tatsugiri to catch prey.
descriptions.tatsugiri: This is a small dragon Pokémon. It lives inside the mouth of Dondozo to protect itself from enemies on the outside.
descriptions.tatsugiri-droopy: This species' differing colors and patterns are apparently the result of Tatsugiri changing itself to suit the preferences of the prey it lures in.
descriptions.tatsugiri-stretchy: Bird Pokémon are its main prey. This Pokémon knows it's weak, so it hunts with a partner.
descriptions.annihilape: When its anger rose beyond a critical point, this Pokémon gained power that is unfettered by the limits of its physical body.
descriptions.clodsire: When attacked, this Pokémon will retaliate by sticking thick spines out from its body. It's a risky move that puts everything on the line.
descriptions.farigiraf: Now that the brain waves from the head and tail are synced up, the psychic power of this Pokémon is 10 times stronger than Girafarig's.
descriptions.dudunsparce: This Pokémon uses its hard tail to make its nest by boring holes into bedrock deep underground. The nest can reach lengths of over six miles.
descriptions.dudunsparce-threesegment: The gentle Dudunsparce will put Pokémon that wander into its nest onto its back and carry them to the entrance.
descriptions.kingambit: Only a Bisharp that stands above all others in its vast army can evolve into Kingambit.
descriptions.greattusk: This creature resembles a mysterious Pokémon that, according to a paranormal magazine, has lived since ancient times.
descriptions.screamtail: It resembles a mysterious Pokémon described in a paranormal magazine as a Jigglypuff from one billion years ago.
descriptions.brutebonnet: It bears a slight resemblance to a Pokémon described in a dubious magazine as a cross between a dinosaur and a mushroom.
descriptions.fluttermane: It has similar features to a ghostly pterosaur that was covered in a paranormal magazine, but the two have little else in common.
descriptions.slitherwing: This Pokémon somewhat resembles an ancient form of Volcarona that was introduced in a dubious magazine.
descriptions.sandyshocks: It slightly resembles a Magneton that lived for 10,000 years and was featured in an article in a paranormal magazine.
descriptions.irontreads: This Pokémon closely resembles a scientific weapon that a paranormal magazine claimed was sent to this planet by aliens.
descriptions.ironbundle: Its shape is similar to a robot featured in a paranormal magazine article. The robot was said to have been created by an ancient civilization.
descriptions.ironhands: It is very similar to a cyborg covered exclusively by a paranormal magazine. The cyborg was said to be the modified form of a certain athlete.
descriptions.ironjugulis: It resembles a certain Pokémon introduced in a paranormal magazine, described as the offspring of a Hydreigon that fell in love with a robot.
descriptions.ironmoth: This Pokémon resembles an unknown object described in a paranormal magazine as a UFO sent to observe humanity.
descriptions.ironthorns: It has some similarities to a Pokémon introduced in a dubious magazine as a Tyranitar from one billion years into the future.
descriptions.frigibax: Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.
descriptions.arctibax: Arctibax freezes the air around it, protecting its face with an ice mask and turning its dorsal fin into a blade of ice.
descriptions.baxcalibur: This Pokémon blasts cryogenic air out from its mouth. This air can instantly freeze even liquid-hot lava.
descriptions.gimmighoul: This Pokémon was born inside a treasure chest about 1,500 years ago. It sucks the life-force out of scoundrels who try to steal the treasure.
descriptions.gimmighoul-roaming: This Pokémon was born from passion that seeped into a coin. It wanders, apparently seeking to return to the treasure chest it once inhabited.
descriptions.gholdengo: Its body seems to be made up of 1,000 coins. This Pokémon gets along well with others and is quick to make friends with anybody.
descriptions.wochien: The grudge of a person punished for writing the king's evil deeds upon wooden tablets has clad itself in dead leaves to become a Pokémon.
descriptions.chienpao: This Pokémon can control 100 tons of fallen snow. It plays around innocently by leaping in and out of avalanches it has caused.
descriptions.tinglu: The fear poured into an ancient ritual vessel has clad itself in rocks and dirt to become a Pokémon.
descriptions.chiyu: It controls flames burning at over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit. It casually swims through the sea of lava it creates by melting rock and sand.
descriptions.roaringmoon: According to an article in a dubious magazine, this Pokémon has some connection to a phenomenon that occurs in a certain region.
descriptions.ironvaliant: It has some similarities to a mad scientist's invention covered in a paranormal magazine.
descriptions.koraidon: This Pokémon resembles Cyclizar, but it is far burlier and more ferocious. Nothing is known about its ecology or other features.
descriptions.miraidon: Much remains unknown about this creature. It resembles Cyclizar, but it is far more ruthless and powerful.
descriptions.walkingwake: It resembles an illustration published in a paranormal magazine, said to be a depiction of a super-ancient Suicune.
descriptions.ironleaves: Many of its physical characteristics match those of a Virizion from the future that was covered in a paranormal magazine.
descriptions.dipplin: Dipplin is two creatures in one Pokémon. Its evolution was triggered by a special apple grown only in one place.
descriptions.poltchageist: Supposedly, the regrets of a tea ceremony master who died before perfecting his craft lingered in some matcha and became a Pokémon.
descriptions.poltchageist-artisan: It sprinkles some of its powdery body onto food and drains the life-force from those who so much as lick it.
descriptions.sinistcha: It pretends to be tea, trying to fool people into drinking it so it can drain their life-force. Its ruse is generally unsuccessful.
descriptions.sinistcha-masterpiece: It lives inside a superb teacup that was crafted by a potter of great renown. Collectors positively adore this Pokémon.
descriptions.okidogi: After all its muscles were stimulated by the toxic chain around its neck, Okidogi transformed and gained a powerful physique.
descriptions.munkidori: The chain is made from toxins that enhance capabilities. It stimulated Munkidori's brain and caused the Pokémon's psychic powers to bloom.
descriptions.fezandipiti: Fezandipiti owes its beautiful looks and lovely voice to the toxic stimulants emanating from the chain wrapped around its body.
descriptions.ogerpon: This Pokémon's type changes based on which mask it's wearing. It confounds its enemies with nimble movements and kicks.
descriptions.ogerpon-wellspring: This form excels in both attack and defense. It ceaselessly unleashes moves like a spring gushes water.
descriptions.ogerpon-hearthflame: This form is the most aggressive, bombarding enemies with the intensity of flames blazing within a hearth.
descriptions.ogerpon-cornerstone: This form has excellent defenses, absorbing impacts solidly like the cornerstones that support houses.
descriptions.archaludon: It gathers static electricity from its surroundings. The beams it launches when down on all fours are tremendously powerful.
descriptions.hydrapple: Seven syrpents live inside an apple made of syrup. The syrpent in the center is the commander.
descriptions.gougingfire: It resembles an eerie Pokémon once shown in a paranormal magazine. That Pokémon was said to be an Entei regenerated from a fossil.
descriptions.ragingbolt: It bears resemblance to a Pokémon that became a hot topic for a short while after a paranormal magazine touted it as Raikou's ancestor.
descriptions.ironboulder: It resembles a Pokémon described in a dubious magazine as a Terrakion that had been modified by an evil organization.
descriptions.ironcrown: It resembles a mysterious object introduced in a paranormal magazine as a cutting-edge weapon shaped like a Cobalion.
descriptions.terapagos: Terapagos protects itself using its power to transform energy into hard crystals. This Pokémon is the source of the Terastal phenomenon.
descriptions.terapagos-terastal: Upon sensing danger, it prepares itself for battle by creating a sturdy shell of crystallized Terastal energy.
descriptions.terapagos-stellar: In this form, Terapagos resembles the world as the ancients saw it, and its Terastal energy is abnormally amplified.
descriptions.pecharunt: It feeds others toxic mochi that draw out desires and capabilities. Those who eat the mochi fall under Pecharunt's control, chained to its will.
descriptions.pikachu-alolabias: This Pokémon has electricity-storing pouches on its cheeks. These appear to become electrically charged during the night while Pikachu sleeps. It occasionally discharges electricity when it is dozy after waking up.
descriptions.exeggcute-alolabias: This Pokémon consists of six eggs that form a closely knit cluster. The six eggs attract each other and spin around. When cracks increasingly appear on the eggs, Exeggcute is close to evolution.
descriptions.cubone-alolabias: Cubone pines for the mother it will never see again. Seeing a likeness of its mother in the full moon, it cries. The stains on the skull the Pokémon wears are made by the tears it sheds.
descriptions.koffing-galarbias: Koffing embodies toxic substances. It mixes the toxins with raw garbage to set off a chemical reaction that results in a terribly powerful poison gas. The higher the temperature, the more gas is concocted by this Pokémon.
descriptions.cyndaquil-hisuibias: Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the Pokémon is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.
descriptions.quilava-hisuibias: Quilava keeps its foes at bay with the intensity of its flames and gusts of superheated air. This Pokémon applies its outstanding nimbleness to dodge attacks even while scorching the foe with flames.
descriptions.pichu-alolabias: When Pichu plays with others, it may short out electricity with another Pichu, creating a shower of sparks. In that event, this Pokémon will begin crying, startled by the flash of sparks.
descriptions.mimejr-galarbias: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokémon.
descriptions.oshawott-hisuibias: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.
descriptions.dewott-hisuibias: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.
descriptions.petilil-hisuibias: Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas where Petilil live are known to be good for growing plants.
descriptions.rufflet-hisuibias: They will challenge anything, even strong opponents, without fear. Their frequent fights help them become stronger.
descriptions.goomy-hisuibias: It's covered in a slimy membrane that makes any punches or kicks slide off it harmlessly.
descriptions.bergmite-hisuibias: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.
descriptions.rowlet-hisuibias: It feels relaxed in tight, dark places and has been known to use its Trainer's pocket or bag as a nest.
descriptions.dartrix-hisuibias: Supremely sensitive to the presence of others, it can detect opponents standing behind it, flinging its sharp feathers to take them out.

moves.desc: A Flying-type attack that Gigantamax Corviknight use. This move removes the effects of moves like Reflect and Light Screen.
